RKsv8cJ0YOwDSURT9l7mvw.text: Called last night after receiving terrible service at another restaurant. Needed a table for 17. They have us a private room with 2 servers!! Service was superb and good was amazing!! Made our holiday outing incredible!

PqyUHYDzacTAiA7kwsuO0w.text: Very nice. Straight forward, rather English in decor...  they have a room downstairs for banquets and groups that is very nice. The meat choices are fresh and deliciously prepared, in fact I would say on par with Morton's and Ruth's Chris at a slightly more palatable price point. The staff was very professional and everything was nicely done.  A good solid dining experience.

qHEOhO0nonAHFWzcY2wSnQ.text: Absolutely great place for a date. Although its kind of land locked, parking is not a problem, the valet service made us feel like someone important.  The ambiance was great, it was packed for Valentines day so we took a high top table in the bar. They had a jazz band (if you want to call it that, a piano player and bass guitarist) I had the filet and my date had a ribeye. Both were seasoned and cooked perfectly. Big helping for side items. Desserts are standard fare but very well done. One of the best meals I've had in a while. Highly recommend this spot!

Uek8AfD-GWxZiaOIp_m-3Q.text: I don't normally give five stars but will in this case. Everything was great at this place while in town this weekend.   Love the location, south end with a lot of good places to chose from to eat and drink. Right off the light rail which we took from downtown.   We wanted to watch March madness so we sat outside with perfect weather.  Started out with the wedge and also we ordered a kale salad.  Pretty standard for steakhouses  We got the ribeye and New York cooked perfectly medium rare with mushrooms and hash browns for sides.  Also a side of bernaise for both.  Mushrooms were amazing and the steaks had just the right amount of seasoning.   Good drinks, food, service, and atmosphere.  Can't wait to get up to Charlotte.

8276SNZtC1XZKKvC4JkdmA.text: I made reservations for 5:15 and got there at 5 with zero wait time...perfect! The waiter was very friendly...perfect! I ordered the Blue Crab Stuffed Shrimp ( from seasonal menu) perfect! My bf ordered 12 oz Filet Mignon...perfect! The dessert was Banana bread pudding with ice cream...awesome!! And I don't even like bread pudding !! This is a must have restaurant!

W9HoFQ2Jq2Rwz77Z2i-yzw.text: My husband and I like to try higher end steakhouses, especially for special occasions.  I had not tried this restaurant before. So he made a reservation for my birthday. I think they have a good menu and the food was very good, I got the bone in ribeye and he got the salmon. Both were well prepared. As an appetizer we did the calamari which was quite good.  That is why I am giving them 3 stars.  My issue is that the service was LACKING for what one would expect at a higher end restaurant. We knew we were going to have an issue the minute we were sat across from a party of 16 celebrating a 50 th birthday. It was a week night, the restaurant was not crowded but for some reason they sat a large party near the front along with several other parties bunched up around  that table, including ours. IMHO they should have seated a party that large away from others. The party was fairly tame but there were times when we could not hear each other because as with any group there is going to be a lot of conversation, and some will be louder than others. I fault management for seating several parties so close together around a large group while other tables near the back sat empty. Doesn't make sense and doesn't enhance the dining experience.  Our waitress was one of the people attending that table. Every time, regardless of whether the restaurant is high end or low end, when we have had a server attending a large party, we have felt shortchanged on service and that was the case here. Our service was delayed the entire meal- from removal of dishes, filling of water glasses,  serving of food. When we asked the server about the table, she flippantly stated oh it was just a group celebrating a 50 the birthday not 20 somethings, so it should not get out of hand. I thought that was an odd comment to make, and somewhat offensive. I am not sure why she had to go there. IMHO her answer should have been, don't worry I'll take good care of you or offered to move us.   My husband had advised that we were celebrating my birthday so she offered a free dessert from the menu- we did the warm chocolate cake which was good. He had planned to order coffee, but she left before he could even do so. Usually coffee is offered. She did not offer it. It felt like she was trying to wrap up us and get us out of there.  We paid the bill and when she returned his credit card, she thanked him by his first name!!  We felt that was unprofessional. Throughout the meal she had a very cavalier, casual attitude with us that I just didn't appreciate.  We chose not to make a scene in the dining area, but when we got to the hostess stand on the way out, we asked to speak to manager. A young manager came out to talk to us, apologized and offered his card with a promise of free drinks and appetizers at a future visit. I would try another steakhouse before coming back here. Restaurants need to remember that you only get one chance to make a first impression.

ydNaQ485geTp5rugiKiGWw.text: When I first went to Sullivan's 10+ years ago, I treated it as an upscale "I need to dress to impress" steakhouse. The second time I went (last year, thinking the same way), I had my boyfriend dress up. Well, when we got there, people had on shorts & flip-flops! Ah well, I digress...  The steaks are yummy & the a la carte sides are delicious. I went with the caesar salad, filet mignon, creamy horseradish mashed potatoes & green beans. My bf got filet mignon, creamed spinach & the same mashed potatoes. So delightful!  The staff is very attentive, the restrooms & restaurant are clean. The bar out front is very relaxed & I love that they have jazz sometimes.  The patio is nice, as well.  Sullivan's is quite pricey, so I have to reserve it only for special occasions.

SN5pYqngPMovwgsnrffT9A.text: Love it here Thursday nights,  Live band,  nice atmosphere,  and the blueberry lemon drop Martini is the best.

5xTBofzgLP5rEz8OFTkafA.text: Had the worst experience with brunch on Easter Sunday. Did not have a reservation but bar and patio were first come first serve. Very poor service - only had one waitress for the entire patio. She was very inattentive to some of the tables. Never had a bad experience, but will think twice before going back on Sundays.

tlGLi_Yxe4d8ACOdp1Wk3w.text: We had a reservation and upon arrival we were told we would have to wait for a table to come available, after waiting 20 mins we decided to eat in the bar. Huge mistake.. Our waitress was very poor, we waited extended amounts of time for service and drinks. Her personality was great though, but personality does not get my drink. Ambiance? Yes there wasn't any, nor was there high end decor or finishes for the prices they charge for a meal. Laminated bar? Really? Also they dining/bar was very loud because of a large group of college boys ordering shots. Our food was cooked perfectly but management needs to work on everything else.. I would not reccomend.

OvUJucySb2WFreTteuqMUw.text: Went to Sullivan's on Valentine's Day and was very disappointed.  Our reservations were 8:15pm.  We arrived at 8:00 to find the line for valet was wrapped around the block.  It seems to me that if you are aware it will be a busy time the valet situation would be better planned out.  There was a pre-fixed menu for the evening was fine but for $89 per person the steak should be tasty.  My date ordered his steak medium well and it was so tough he was unable to cut it.  My creamed spinach was cold and my date's mashed potatoes were very stiff.  There was a lady going from table to table taking pictures, however she never stopped by to ask us if we wanted a photo.  Yes I am African American and I never use the race card but it was very strange that she never came to our table.  I've been to Sullivan's before but this will be my final visit.

jXdfvomEZNsA4C1f0HClWQ.text: During a quick trip to Charlotte, we stopped in at Sullvian's in between apartment tours. Conveniently located in Charlotte's South End neighborhood, Sullivan's appears to be a great spot to grab lunch, dinner, or a drink. We arrived on a Tuesday just before they officially opened for lunch (11:30). To my surprise, aside from us there was only one other party waiting to be seated. And, throughout our short 30 minute stay I didn't see anyone else come in the door. We weren't really hungry for lunch, but we each ordered a bloody Mary. I think we were both in the mood for a drink with a homemade mix, but they use the premixed commercial stuff that you can find in just about any food store. The drinks were a bit on the weaker side, so we then transitioned over to wine (which, btw, we should have ordered in the first place). We didn't order any food as we ended up dining at the 7th Street Market later in the day.  Lastly, one of the highlights of our time at Sullivan's was the extremely friendly and outgoing bartender who, just happened to also be from Pittsburgh. We enjoyed talking with her and hearing about her experiences in Charlotte.  If we move into the area, we'd likely give Sullivan's another go.

ct1Ht47mKmgKx6RkqDOSBg.text: Last Friday was my first visit to a Sullivan's Steakhouse, and I have to admit I was impressed. I've frequented chain Steakhouses before; Morton's, Ruth Chris', Capital Grille, etc... and Sullivan's definitely ranks up there as one of my favorites (Capital Grille, not being one of them!).   Definitely start with the Crispy Shanghai Calamari and the Iceberg Lettuce Wedge Salad...both are amazing! The salad had a blue cheese dressing which I liked...and I do not generally like blue cheese! I had the Chili Crusted Ribeye...delicious. My fiance had the Pan Seared Sea Bass Hong Kong Style, which I liked, but she wasn't in love with. My in-laws went for the 3 course dinner for 2, and at $79, it was definitely a good deal!   A little on the pricey side, as Steakhouses can be, but a good meal with great service for the price tag.   PS: Order a Mojito...best I ever tasted.

BPA32o86CPUOxDbEceWZsg.text: I really expected to write a 4 star review for this place.  Let me begin by saying we decided to eat dinner here on a Thursday night.  We thought to ourselves, "oh it won't be crowded".  Wrong.  It was packed!  I had the bone in KC steak and it was stupendous!  Couldn't get a better cooked steak if I tried!  Where the rating starts to fall is the feeling of the place.  While the bar area seemed nice and warm and cozy.  The dining area with it's low booths and open area seating takes away from the experience in my opinion.  I want a little seclusion some times.  But all in all this place is a solid dinner choice.

ncG8OlwzPEoRT8b2JQmucw.text: This place was awesome! We went here for Valentine's Day dinner and had the prix frixe menu. They had a great selection!! We started with cocktails. I got the martini with blue cheese olives and my boyfriend got the sweet chocolatey specialty cocktail. They were great! I did order some more olive juice for my martini because I like them extra dirty. We then got the Caesar salad and shrimp and lobster bisque. The soup was incredible. For our entrees we got the lobster and filet that came with 2 sides. We got the garlic mashed potatoes and the lobster Mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese was okay but the steak and lobster was incredible. So were the appetizers. For dessert we got the chocolate mousse and the cheesecake. The chocolate mousse was very rich and good. All in all a great experience. The only thing that wasn't perfect was the timing. We did have to wait about 30 minutes or so past when our reservation time was but it wasn't too bad. I just wish they would have been a little more clear about the timing. We got a text 15 mins after our reservation time saying that our table was ready and then when we told the hostess we didn't get seated until about 15 or so minutes after that so we aren't sure if they had forgotten about us or not. But turns out they hadn't forgotten and we got seated and all in all it was a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The specialty chocolate and baileys cocktail and a dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives

FHCpKEme8VnicNtBsw1ckQ.text: The absolute WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!! From the valet to the hostess to the person that pours the water .... horrible Valentine's Day atmosphere. I had a reservation for 8:00pm waited for an hour.... to watch people without reservations be seated. Once we were seated, I felt like we were in Piccadilly or k&w ... tables super close, very very loud.... the guy that pours the water poured it as he was walking and it spills all over the table and he keeps walking... we waited 5 more mins no one came... we got up and left! I frequent four and five star restaurants and this my friends is very commercial and UNPROFESSIONAL!!  Poor quality, poor atmosphere, super poor service, with obvious DISCRIMINATION!!! I didn't want to give it 1 star!! I will NEVER go there again in LIFE!!! The absolute worse!!!

rGTLNEZ9y0kPSsYDH1ykLQ.text: Absolutely loved Sullivans!  Drinks: Try their Pinot Noir that starts with an S, this Pinot had great body and I enjoyed a couple glasses. They have many options of wines, but this was the only one by the glass. Starter: I am a lover of Seared Rare Ahi Tuna but the spicy mustard sauce was too much. Other than that, the tuna was a good option. Salad: Split the wedge. It was very crisp, and the blue cheese was very flavorful! Entree: I loved the Filet Duxelle Mushroom Stuffed 8oz steak! Very delicious and I highly recommend! Side Dishes: Ask for the Loaded Baked Potato FULLY loaded! They put the white cheddar cheese sauce on it that they use in their Mac and Cheese. This was along with the normal loaded options. Delicious! The Steakhouse Skillet Mushrooms were great too! I'm clearly a fan of mushrooms... Dessert: Go for the seasonal Peanut Butter Black Bottom Pie! Don't even hesitate on this one if you like peanut butter. Presentation was beautiful and I loved the salted peanuts, caramel, and chocolate shavings that topped this amazing dessert! Will be back!

keF4pWylFRpBDybekDjDZw.text: Delicious and expensive place for an excellent steak dinner. Service is excellent. We did the Sunday special for $40 each that was a 3 course meal. Ended up being a better price since this place is a la carte like many nice steakhouses are. The service was absolutely wonderful and we will definitely return.

_gLzd0p5IFZU4IU31jKSxA.text: Yay! I'm a fan. Great salmon! Nice atmosphere. Wouldn't recommend this place for a lunch destination. A little on the slow side.

58Fy9ubkQT1RmBdW_hGPWg.text: 1/13/2017 I took my daughter here to celebrate her 18th birthday. The experience was flawless. The food was amazing; all of it. The best part was the service, My server Cristhia was awesome, kind, thoughtful, and genuine.  Mary, Cristhia, Jessica, and the whole staff, thank you; I appreciate everything you did to make this day special for my daughter. I will be back!

BffrWhgiF1eGvqUROFtP2A.text: Excellent steakhouse. Highly recommend the lobster bisque... very creamy. The filet mignon was cooked perfectly - nice and pink on the inside. For dessert, I highly recommend the bread pudding. The cheesecake is average.   As for service - we were seated right away which doesn't always happy at restaurants on a Saturday night even with reservations. Our waiter was very attentive though towards the end I felt a little rushed out.   My only critique would be a better beer selection. They only had a small number on tap.

3rf64KX1kizWbEJx0DVRNQ.text: Made reservation for 9:30, was sat at 10:12. Not sure what point our reservation served. As a frequent and loyal customer of Sullivan's, I've never experienced such a long wait time with a reservation. We were told numerous of times that our table was being cleaned off only to witness people come in after us to be seated before us. This did not leave a great taste in my mouth at all. It'll be a long time before I step foot back into this establishment. Our waiter was not attentive, he took our order and then brought our salad. The next we saw him was when we finished our meal. We had to look for him in order to ask for the check. This was definitely not the service that I am used to receiving. This delayed our entire evening and we were late to our next event.

aQ-gFKOJaU8IFmteXt5uhQ.text: I been here quite a few times.. Many gathering and birthday parties. This year, the girls and I decided it's best to ring the New Year with Sullivan's.. For this day. They have a set menu. Many choices you can pick from in each categories.. I have Evan as our waiter this time.. and per usual their customer service have alway been on point.. I'm not sure if the kitchen was slammed. But this time the steak is bit too tough and a little more done than I would like but any other times, I'm completely satisfied.. looking forward to many more celebrations at Sullivan's!

c2dPWjHl25YCSf6Sxg53ow.text: This place was amazing! My husband brought me here for my birthday and they gave me a rose and treated both of us really great.  He made reservations for us before the big dinner rush and after we sat down that's when it started getting crowded.  I've been wanting to come here for the longest and finally we came and we got:  The summer fling The New York strip 12oz, au gratin potatoes  2 waters Raspberry belini  Chocolate cake with raspberry sauce and vanilla ice cream  For a total of 150 Not too bad in my opinion  WE LOVED EVERYTHING! We're definitely coming back a lot more.

ma9QdgWQ4rROm3Fe_dS_kg.text: My little brother had just turned 21, and as a Marine he didn't often get to enjoy delicious food so I wanted to treat him to a great steakhouse. After reading lots of Yelp reviews, I had decided on Sullivan's Steakhouse.  To reduce the wait, I originally made a reservation earlier in the week for 730, but when I tried to change it online it said that my reservation wasn't found. When I called, they acted like I wanted a new reservation, so to move on I just created a new one for 8 pm. We had a couple beers at Sycamore earlier in the night, so we walked over to Sullivan's and got there right at 8 pm. We were really hungry, but were told that they were running behind and it should only be about 15/20 minutes, we weren't pleased, but it was a nice night so we waited outside. At about 8:25, I went inside to check in again and they said that they were still waiting on tables.... then at 8:50, we were finally seated. I understand that sometimes the tables are running behind, but I definitely did not make a reservation to be seated almost an hour later. It would be great if they would have texted us that they were running late so that we could have stayed at Sycamore.   To counter this, the service from our waiter was spectacular. We got a free appetizer for our wait (no I didn't ask) and when we ordered the crab cakes the waiter gave us advice that with out 4 people, it might make more sense to get another appetizer. We definitely appreciated that advice!  We ordered 2 bottles of wine along with dinner, and ordered steaks along with some sides served tableside. I got the filet mignon, and it was perfectly cooked, buttery and melt in your mouth. I also got the Cajun butter, which is butter that has Cajun spices that you can put on your steak (which then melts.) I liked how they didn't automatically add it so you were able to control how much butter is on your steak. We got the mushrooms, asparagus, king crab gnocchi and garlic horseradish mashed potatoes. My favorite was definitely the king crab gnocchi- spicy and creamy, with chunks of jalapenos.  You probably only need about a side per person maximum, as they are large in conjunction with the steak. We were pretty full, but the waiter approached us and said that we could get any desert, on the house to celebrate my brother's birthday. I know that he was really excited and they even added a Happy Birthday message! He got the Peanut Butter Pie, and it was rich, fluffy, with thinly sliced chocolate pieces on top and a chocolate black bottom.  We spent about $400 for 4 people, including 2 bottles of wine. We did get the appetizer and a desert for free, but overall I think it is expensive but reasonably priced based on the quality of the food and the service. I was disappointed with how they handled the reservation, but everything other than that was incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thanks Sullivan&#39;s Steakhouse for making my brothers birthday extra special with some delicious birthday peanut butter pie! So incredible!

JbiJhdr71HdFlj8pZj07xw.text: I have been here a few times and am a big fan. The food is always amazing and the service prompt. I have had the ribeye and fillet and they were both delicious. The sure thing menu is a great addition to the regular menu. This place is pretty expensive so I only go for special occasions.

DFNz9sbIn_i03eyn7g1GPw.text: Had a really good filet mignon and scallop potatoes! Really great service too! I would definitely go back.

eT_3lJytBJV9doRc1zi6JA.text: Recently went to Sullivans for restaurant week. My husband and I wanted to have a nice dinner date. The service was very good and we were seated quickly. The food was OK, even with the sauce and butter options, The steak was mediocre. The dessert was cheesecake, it tasted like the refrigerator it was kept in. The food overall did not taste super fresh. I'm glad we went for restaurant week because I would not have been happy paying full price.

BFuB6u74emOTXBRkvtAXaQ.text: If you're in the mood for a fancy night out, celebrating a special event, or looking for an upscale place to have cocktails with coworkers, Sullivan's Steakhouse is the place for you. I came on a Wednesday around 6PM and the place was already packed! They have complimentary Valet parking that work off of just tips which eases the pain of trying to find parking in this busy spot. Luckily we were seated right away by the very welcoming hostesses who actually made you feel like they wanted you to have a great experience - which is a rarity.   Come here on a Wednesday. Drinks that are normally $11-$14 are discounted at $7 which is great way to save a few bucks and still feel fancy. Confirm with hostesses on the timing for that happy hour, it may be from only 5PM-630PM.   I ordered the Filet stuffed with Mushrooms and it was like butter. The mash potatoes and mac and cheese sides were worthy of licking off the plate. I certainly left feeling satisfied on a full belly of delicious dirty martinis (with blue cheese stuffed olives -- yum!) steak, and sides. Highly recommend for a fine dining experience!

bhWzYxuUsBYHoS0Js2u0AQ.text: Was here for the recent #wwlp2014 and it's the first time I have been here.  The bar area is nice and gets fairly packed!  There are tables tucked around the corners, which give you some intimacy if you can snag one.  It's hard to order a drink if you aren't sitting directly at the bar.  They should have a server come around and take orders when there are a lot of people standing in the bar area.  (can you say lost revenue?)  The event was in a private room in the back, which has another patio-type room at the other end, so longer and narrow.  They packed in an amazing amount of pretty people, music and fun for the evening.  They were serving a Knockout Cocktail, which was pineapple and delicious.  Apps were a big hit... cheesesteak egg rolls (oh, so good), bruschetta and shrimp cocktail.    The staff were a bit overwhelmed by the crowd, but stayed very focused and handled everyone pleasantly.  I would say one minus is when you come blasting out of this high-energy event you are tromping right through the middle of the dining room... I felt bad for the diners who were startled by the sudden interruption of their quiet meals. oops.  Overall, with the staff and the quality of refreshments, I'd try Sullivan's again, but this time for dinner!

iOn_Dy1P1yFjcHkbpVg9_Q.text: It was as advertised. It was a great choice  for  restaurant  week. Everything was grade A. Our server Chris was awesome and very knowlegeable  about the menu. I would highly recommend  this  place.

XYcKc2o18hcKR9aPEmae6A.text: The food is delicious and the service was great! The wine list will have something for everyone. If you need a suggestion try the Sequoia Grove Cabernet - it's pricey, but worth every penny. Excellent atmosphere for a variety of occasions. If you're not feeling like having a steak, try the Salmon - you won't be disappointed!

STWQjL21DNaCIU4u9kTrqQ.text: 1st visit and dinner was delicious including drinks and appetizers at bar. The staff was welcoming and friendly.  There was a crowd as it was restaurant week but we were not rushed.

kvKg5DqxhtB4HAhG9SFzGA.text: Yummy!!! Filet wasn't cooked right though and I feel like for this sort of venue it should be. Longhorns, Texas roadhouse, steak cooking wrong I get I'm paying  $12.  For this price my steak should have some pink at medium lol it was all brown???? Still tender as can be, service great, etc. But I don't get to spend that kind of money often and i didn't want to wait on a re cook because I wanted to eat with my boyfriend not 10 min later.

O87r2ZNn8nq0fuEXNsS6sg.text: This is a good mid tier steakhouse in my opinion. I think it's a little more casual than BLT or Delfriscos. I do like the 3 course option and I think it's a reasonable price for what you get.y food has always been well prepared and the wait staff have been helpful friendly and knowledgeable.

hGBFFQ-dz_F1wh_C_Sx6fA.text: I've been to Sullivan's in Baton Rouge and had excellent service every time- the waitresses and bartenders were prompt and very cordial. I went here this evening in Charlotte and ate at the bar...my meat was cooked incorrectly, the bread was the last item to hit the table, and I was overcharged for an additional beer by the bartender. When I asked for the beer (since I had not received it), I got blown off.   Upsetting. Not sure I'll go back. Be careful of your bill if you do.

U0m3an0mTv_mIYmX7GhuOw.text: Anniversary Dinner was great. Amber greeted us with a smile and was very friendly even saying happy anniversary.  Bob was assigned to our table and he was great.  All his food suggestions were great. Crabcake appetizer was amazing.  Trout stuffed with crab meat ummm ummm good.  Will definitely be back

NQq0kWIK2T1ktT9OJZPv4w.text: The steak here was very juicy and delicious.  The atmosphere was classy and the service was very good.  I have enjoyed everything from the steaks to the sides here.  Would like to come back soon!

9vQMf-oRXXqY3JY5rnTGzQ.text: Great food and great ambiance! Staff is knowledgeable of their menu options and on queue. Food is delicious and fresh- highly recommend this Steak and Seafood establishment!

h_xojnNDlwkDUlJOXwSRyg.text: We had probably the worst experience tonight. We love steak and will typically eat any that comes our way. The steak here was just awful. We waited a very long time for our meals and when our bone in ribeye and KC strip arrived they were both very cold and overly chewy for steaks that are served medium rare to medium. We brought this to the attention to the manager and his response was an indifferent 'What do you want me to do?' I would think trying to serve a high quality meal would be rather obvious. Unfortunately we did not get that tonight. We won't be coming back.

Rpfc3wndqUVnNGbCnhc9Ig.text: Well after many attempts to try this well known establishment we finally made it. Not to shabby but do have some complaints. At first, service was impeccable. But then, we were left for long periods of time and I had to go without coffee a couple of times and had to resort to the ice water to wash my food down messing up the flavor ratio that I was enjoying with the coffee. Anywho, we went during restaurant week and did order from that menu. We both had the same thing which was the iceberg lettuce wedge with the homemade blue cheese dressing for what was considered the first course and then the 8 oz filet with the horseradish mashed potatoes and sauteed  green beans for the second course and finally the bananas foster bread pudding with caramel sauce and vanilla bean ice cream. The wedge was o.k. as the homemade blue cheese dressing wasn't any better than what I could make at home. Hence "Homemade" I assume. The filets we order well-done and have had disastrous results at other places but there have been a few that actually know how to cook a well-done steak and not let it become dry and disgusting. This wasn't one of those places, or at least not when we went. We found that the cook had gashed opened our filets to see if they were in fact well-done and anyone who knows anything about cooking steak will agree that the last thing one should do is cut into a freshly cooked steak as it will lose most of the juices. This is exactly what occurred here. What a shame too. The sauteed green beans where very crunchy and could have stayed in the pan a bit longer. The mashed potatoes were more than likely the best thing about the whole meal. I really cannot think of a thing wrong with them other than there could have been more of them. They were very good. And last but not least, The bread pudding. I wouldn't order this again as it came out room temp. and the first bite had me at "a little stale". It could, and should, have been much better. Especially for the type of place this is supposed to be. What time the waitress did spend with us, she was warm and welcoming plus very helpful in answering all our questions. We will have to come and give them another chance after all the fuss and muss of this restaurant week passes. Maybe when it is a time that they are not offering specials so we can see if there is a difference in the regular menu food and service as opposed to the price you pay for the specials. Is it one of those times when you get what you pay for?
