Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The wedge salad with homemade blue cheese dressing.

_05Pr7vo884v1kFH-o14ig.text: This place was superb in all respects: food, presentation, service, ambiance.  It really left nothing to be desired in a five-star steakhouse experience.  And the fact that the Chicago Bears picked up the tab made it all the sweeter. ;)  Our party of eight ordered the oysters Rockefeller, seared ahi tuna tartare, fried calamari, and seafood sampler appetizers.  I tried all but the last, and all were adequate-to-amazing.  The oysters Rockefeller were goeey-cheesy, spinachy and warm, with just the slightest tinge of salty oyster flavor beneath.  The ahi tuna tartare was fresh, perfectly seared and presented beautifully.  Even the standard calamari was above-average: warm and soft, not rubbery in the slightest.  My wedge salad with diced roma tomatoes, fresh-ground black pepper and creamy bleu cheese dressing was melt-in-your-mouth delicious.  The lobster bisque, presented with a zig-zag of cream down the middle, was a tad salty for my tastes.  But it did boast more than the usual amount of lobster chunks.  I've had better, but this was still good.  For my entree, I enjoyed the 12-ounce filet mignon with gorgonzola butter melted over it.  My date had the jumbo scallops with spicy Thai sauce.  Both were dazzling.  My steak was lean, immensely flavorful and perfectly prepared (warm and pink throughout, with no raw parts in the middle).  Our party ordered family-style sides: creamed spinach, asparagus with Hollandaise, horseradish mashed potatoes and au gratin potatoes.  I didn't try the spinach, but the rest were terrific.  And plentiful: nobody was left wanting for any of them.  For dessert, I enjoyed the bananas Foster bread pudding.  I'm normally not a bread pudding kinda guy, but it stood out on the dessert menu, so I gave it a shot.  I was not disappointed: hot, smooth, firm, with the perfect amount of banana, real whipped cream and vanilla bean ice cream.  The cappucino served with dessert was lukewarm, but the service staff came around and topped it off with fresh hot coffee.  Speaking of the service staff, they could not have been more attentive to all of the various mundane tasks that often get overlooked: refilling water glasses, whisking away finished plates, scooping up crumbs with those nifty crumb-scooper-upper thingies.  Our server's knowledge of the menu and specials was thorough, and he was beyond helpful and attentive.  I don't anticipate being in Charlotte again, but if I ever am, I will flock back to Sullivan's.  Please give it a try!

A_Xs0FjPUZLYv_iaFNwYlQ.text: Sullivan's has one of the best bar menus in town. If you're looking for a cheap, delicious meal, good drink, cool atmosphere and a nice band, this place is for you! Two meals for $9.95! Wow... But, you have to sit in the bar and patio area to get this deal. I usually go on Thurs evenings because the bar special lasts all nite.  The dinner menu also has some great items. I would suggest the crab fried rice and for dessert, the Banana's Foster Bread Pudding. I've never been a bread pudding fan, but after just one bite of theirs, I was hooked!

mdx_9Gi907oQ5NtdN08Evg.text: Passing through Charlotte on business and decided to try Sullivan's.  It is a good, solid steakhouse.  I had the Kansas City Bone-In Strip and it was perfectly cooked and tender, unfortunately, a little too much pepper.  Otherwise the sides were tasty: White Cheese Au Gratin Potato and Asparagus.  I liked the dark interior with hints of art deco.  The service was prompt, attentive and friendly.

zc982rp6Ce349t3kFEfeWw.text: DO NOT EVER GO TO THEIR THURSDAY HAPPY HOUR IT SUCKS (PERIOD)...actually let me elaborate; the service is miserable and I wasn't ordering from their cheapo menu, bought a $50 app and had to grab my own FN silverware...this place is going downhill fast.  sucks i used to love sullivans but am having doubts about ever going back

UE5KRtvCorvnOVs0p26uEg.text: This is probably close to being, if not my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. The decor sort of has that art deco, 1930's feel to it. I have dined here three or four times and also stopped in for dessert and a drink. Thursday night they usually have a jazz band. They also have a decent, very affordable bar/late night menu. For dinner I have had their steak, crab legs and sea bass which have all been excellent. We weren't able to get in anywhere around here (Lake Norman area) for restaurant week last year at the last minute so we made reservations for Sullivan's and drove right down. I also enjoyed their chocolate covered strawberries at the bar around Valentine's Day. As far as drinks go they make great martini's and have a decent wine selection.

YYTE7MzIe9j3bm8YavgPoQ.text: Perfect for: First Date A night out with spouse Nigh out for just drinks (specials are AWESOME)-sit at the bar A swanky place to pre-game

A_FxZcXmuNMejpP7nS3cUg.text: YUM-ME! The steaks at this place are pretty awesome. I ordered the steak and lobster tail and got pretty full. Their specialty drinks are awesome. My friend ordered a couple of side dishes, but I was too full to eat any of them.

Xh0NLs4pnsME2lPpgIL9qQ.text: Visited during restaurant week, (on a Sunday) and was happy with quality and quantity of food, special thanks to the $30 prix fixe menu. The service was top notch, as was the atmosphere. Two minor flaws kept me from giving a 5 star rating: Too much peppery seasoning on the NY Strip, which was of excellent quality and could have stood on its own - and the failure of the bartender to mention the $5 martini specials when as asked about them. (We found out during our meal from our waiter) All things considered, a great experience, and we will be back!

uvUaBkt-xkpBWza3SzaHwQ.text: Let me get to the point. This steak house is ok. We have other steak houses in Charlotte. Chris, Morton, Capitol,  Frisco, Palm and Outback. If you're searching for a good steak?

kOYVQJtgjxdch7A8giYeDg.text: We love going to Sullivan's.  I have been to the one in King of Prussia, PA (1) in Chicago (1) and the one in Charlotte (6).  We love jazz and this is the best place in Charlotte we have found to check it out, even better than Blue.  We like that we can go eat formal in the main dining area or take advantage of the happy hour and bar menu hanging out listening to jazz all night.  We have been there 6 times in 2011 and plan to go at least 1 Saturday per month moving fwd.  Considering it is close to an hour from our house, you can tell that we enjoy going to Sullivan's.  Service is great.  Jazz is great.  The food is an 8 out of 10.  Fairly pricey and you get more or less what you would expect.  We take friends with us about 50% of the time and they have all loved going and talk about it afterwards.

iyOd4c3WMLgkk42XpotQ8Q.text: I will NEVER go there for Thursday Happy Hour again.  This used to be one of my favorite spots to meet up with friends.  From the staff that was difficult in working with a group of 10 to the rude patrons that keep coming up to us to get our table- total disappointment!!

cPwmoHz4CoWZN_EiGyUpew.text: Thank you Natasha and Sullivan's! What a wonderful experience we had for our son and daughter-in-law's Rehearsal Dinner there last Friday night. We could not have been happier with how it all turned out. Natasha was such a pleasure to work with - her attention to detail, professionalism and helpfulness went above and beyond. She made sure everything was perfect for our event, right down to helping us decorate the private room (which took almost 4 hrs. but looked beautiful when finished!) and attending to our every need. Our three servers, (Spencer, Evan and Amy) were excellent and the food was delicious. All of our guests had a wonderful time and the evening was a huge success! I would highly recommend Sullivan's for your next special event and cannot say enough about their event planner Natasha Demaio and the expert care she took to help ensure our guests had a wonderful evening and our very special dinner was a perfect event!

Cbhj8XSI538WPak3f0BZDg.text: So I'm having a steakhouse conversation with some friends and Sullivan's comes up...I know it's a chain, and I know there are more popular places in town, but if you have been here multile times, the overall consistency of the experience at Sullivan's stands out in my mind! I can't say that I've ever had a bad meal or service experience here. Of the upscale steakhouses (Del Frisco's, Beef and Bottle, Morton's, Ruth's Chris, Palm, etc), Sullivan's may not rate as the best in each category (food, service, value, atmosphere), but I would put it 2 or 3 in each one - thus giving it the title of Charlotte's best steakhouse.

8DJt1YVS_K19SM6dSkFILg.text: Pricey. Its a fancy atmosphere with not-so-great food and service. I expected more for my money.

wh8Zj0gRHJQ6tDqOB7mr2w.text: My steak was over cooked and covered in a thin tastless gravy.  Don't waste your time.

Z9pBLLwUL5t-jnFyFe2nlA.text: Love the knock out drink, love the lamb, love the cowboy if they cook it right, love the Grande Marnier Souffle the most.  What I don't like is the really poor service.  We have eaten here a dozen times and service is hit or miss.  Went in their twice and got rare cowboy steak when I asked for medium.  I know it's hard to cook, but...The second time it happened they brought it out three times. The first time it was raw with barely any marks, the second time it was medium rare, then they left it on till it was black and the manager came out with it and tried to convince me it was medium.  No apologies, no fresh steak, no free desert.  I did not eat it or send it back and no one cared.  At those prices I was fed up.  My husband an I tried to give it another shot recently after seeing a movie.  We went in to get drinks and a dessert.  The kitchen was closed a few minutes before we sat down.  We asked if we could get a cold desert, peice of bread, or a pretzel?  Nothing, just drinks.  After one with out food, we were done.  Sad to say Sullie's is comin' off the list.  :(

8XQPiN4CVvzDmbqJilYg4g.text: Excellent, classic steakhouse.  I had the privilage of going while my boyfriend's boss was picking up the tab, so that was a huge plus for me.  The food was great!  I had a mushroom duxelle filet with creamed spinach and white cheddar au gratin potatoes.  My steak was cooked perfectly and it had a goat cheese butter melted over the top that was to die for.  The steak really was delicious, but that sauce could have been served over an old sneaker and made it taste good.  The side dish portions are HUGE and definitely shar-able.  The table had oysters rockefeller, crab cakes, and calamari for appetizers and there was plenty to go around for all of us (table of 9).  The calamari are some of the best I have ever eaten.  They are gigantic, not rubbery at all, and have that fresh seafood melt-in-your-mouth quality.  The piece de resistance for me, however, was their signature Knockout martini.  They infuse chunks of pineapple in orange vodka for over a week and then crush it up, put it over ice, and strain the concoction into a martini glass.  Yowza....it is awesome!  Definitely pricey, but well worth it.  Good, solid food and our service was top-notch.

BXjsoQq1cKJaqhwh0Y9T7g.text: You want a great steak, a good bottle of wine and a nice place to enjoy it with experienced, knowledgeable staff?  Go to Sullivan's.  End of story.

whqBd801PP6FWsAkFxw9fw.text: We dined at Sullivan's last Friday night to celebrate our anniversary.  The place was packed!!  I could not believe how busy the restaurant was.  The staff was fantastic!  We went to the bar and had the pineapple martini  (Knockout).  The bartenders were having a great time with us.  When we sat down, I realized why this place was so busy.  We ordered the ahi tuna appetizer and calamari.  The calamari was the best that I ever had.  Our steaks were fantastic.  I had mine with crab and asparugus.  Just when we thought the meal could not get any better, our server surprised us with a chocolate souffle for our anniversary.  I don't know how she knew it was our anniversary.  My husband and I have been coming here since we moved to Charlotte.  This restaurant continues to get better when others decline.

7ii9_3ninSWE2zeQeOpBGQ.text: The first time I visited this location I was throughly pleased with the service and the quality of the meal. I decided to take a few friends with me this time and I was quite disappointed. I had the 12oz Filet Mignon, prepared medium rare, closer to the rare side. When it arrived I was upset when I cut into a medium cooked piece of meat. I brought it to our waitresses attention (who was very pleasant throughout our visit) and she took it back to be corrected right away. The weight wasn't long before the manager arrived with a new cut that was suppose to be prepared correctly this go around. Once again I was disappointed when I cut into another improperly prepared steak. I was too frustrated at the time to address it again, plus my company was already half way through their own meals. I enjoyed all other aspects of my meal except the steak and cheesecake. It's unfortunate that such a high quality restaurant can be so inconsistent with its food. Will give them one last shot, a best two out of three hopefully.

ZBvetzp0qmWmSUvqg9ks7Q.text: Awesome service, and incredible food! We were at Alex's table and he was a great server. I was really impressed because most high end places take all night bring food thinking you want to be there the whole evening. They did a wonderful job keeping our pace moving through glasses of wine, apps, lobster bisque,  the main course and we were in and out in an hour and a half and had a tremendous experience. Will be back!

JojIsFkbMkFlj03NLHaxnA.text: Noms!  We sat at the bar, so I am not sure of the atmosphere in the restaurant, but the atmosphere in the bar was fairly mellow.  I had an 8oz fillet  Mignon and a wedge salad.  The salad was drowned in dressing, but that can be prevented in the future by ordering it on the side.  The only negative thing I have to say about the steak is that they wanted me to order all kinds of crap to put on top of it.  A good, proper steak only needs to be served with a side of au jus!  The meat was properly cooked, and I ate the whole thing.  On Sunday nights, the drink menu is half price, so I had 2 froofy martinis.  They were pretty good too.  Our server was very nice as well, and did her job well.  This place is also fairly gluten-free friendly, but as with any place, you have to remind the staff over and over that no, you can't have the bread and butter that they placed in front of you, and that is a bit irritating.

pCUNSNHiauh1THcdXvCt2A.text: This is the best Sullivan's I have been to.  The Bartender, Luke, is VERY knowledgeable, and friendly.  I eat here for lunch about once a week, and am there for dinner every now & again.    I have yet to have a bad meal.  Service is always very friendly, and if something does go wrong (happened 1 time) the management was extremely understanding & helpful.  For my money, it rarely gets better than Sullivan's in Dilworth - for the complete package.

0mUGY4NEbx0rxA7k8XCqKw.text: Great service! They were very nice! My steak wasn't fully cooked how I asked and without me even saying anything a lady who might have been the manager walked over and asked me about my steak and if it's the color I wanted. I was honest but very nice about it saying i'll heat it up and have it for lunch the next day. She insisted on bringing me a new one. I declined. Ten minutes later she comes out with a whole new steak and sides and offers to box up mine for me. She assured me how she wants me to be fully happy and satisfied right then and there. Such exceptional customer service, It was also my anniversary and my waiter brought out free dessert which was so sweet and thoughtful. Love this place and I'm a regular especially for happy hour and take out!

0DkM3p2M4rkODZ9l8sPA4A.text: Sullivan's has been our favorite steakhouse in the Charlotte area for years. We have celebrated many special occasions there, and we take out-of-town guests there.  Then last week happened. We were seated at the very last booth toward the kitchen and serving counter. I was intrigued with how it all worked so while we waited, I watched.  Much to my dismay, the gentleman working the counter picked up a spoon, looked at it, then used his finger and thumb to wipe it off. Then he put it into a bowl of broccoli. The next incident was even worse. This same man had been wiping the edges of the plates ready to be served.  He DROPPED the cloth on the floor, picked it up, and continued wiping.  I discussed this with the manager and he replaced that man. The new man wore gloves and everything appeared alright. But it disturbs me that it happened at all.

QC0yguGSpA-v9r9uMY2FxA.text: Fine dining without the snobbery, Sullivan's in Charlotte is an excellent place to get some surf and turf. Great wait staff too. Took a bachelor party to eat there and when the food came out there were 6 very quiet guys chowing down on a great meal.  Funny rumor; beware of cougars at the bar.

b-tccE29QXHu-K3QNtZ6aw.text: I have not yet experienced Sullivan's steaks, but have recently been to a Thursday night drink and entertainment night at their bar and patio. I was disappointed in their mixed drinks, bad enough that I switched to wine shortly thereafter; the entertainment was great though! Nice mix of patrons there as well. I will go again in hopes that it was just an "off" night for the bartenders.

bML3vmF-v52-JhWx3U-J7w.text: Warm and appealing restaurant. The drinks were good. (order the lemon blueberry martini!) Odd choice of background music, though. Not that I don't love me some 60s Motown; just strange having James Brown screeching in the background of a somewhat upscale chain restaurant. The food was okay. I ordered the filet; it was well past the medium I requested and, to my taste, everything seemed extremely salty, including the horseradish mashed potatoes and the mushroom caps. The server was quite attentive, almost a little too much so; it was hard to carry on a conversation. But I guess that's quibbling and better than having to hunt down your server. As someone mentioned, the banana bread pudding was to die for.

CZDM6ZD7P2Y-Qszl0VfMlA.text: Took my BF for a steak dinner here.  The prices were reasonable for an upper-scale steakhouse, and the place appears to be known for its martinis, which we love, so off we went.  The steaks were great!  I got the filet, and the BF got the NY strip.  I think we both agreed that my steak was tastier, since it was so tender. I agree with the previous reviewer that they put a lot of pepper on the steaks, but I really thought it added to the flavor.  He got horseradish mashed potatoes on the side, which I thought were delicious.  I got a baked potato, which they dress for you table-side.  All the steaks are served with a wedge salad with blue cheese.  It was very tasty, although I thought it would be better with bacon -- perhaps you should ask for that on the side, if you go.  After dinner, we had Irish coffees.  Not on the dessert menu, but they were happy to oblige.  So, bottom line, how do I feel about this place?  OK, so a couple of things that I wasn't too jazzed about, and I felt like this impacted my general opinion about the restaurant service:  1) Our waitress was very nice, but scarce.  Wouldn't have been that big of a deal, except for....  2) My potato was not hot.  I know, I know, I'm being high-maintenance, right? But I don't think so.  I've decided to come here, pay for a $35 steak.  The least you can do is bring me a potato that's not ROOM TEMPERATURE.  Seriously.  I want to eat my $7 baked potato with the rest of my meal.  I had to wait a while before I could track her down.  Overall, the meal was good.  The ambiance is nice.  Steak is good.  I'd recommend going here -- just don't order the baked potato!

leqo9nk2gVX-aq0HX7zzHg.text: decent, had to check it out as I have heard great things on Sully's from neighbors.   serve and food wad middle of the road.

gwXec9Fw0BeNmRg1bNiLfQ.text: I just went out with a friend to this place last week.  I did read some comments from Yelpers as it's my first time.  Firstly, I was disappointed with the parking there.  Suit... I almost left as I drove round the whole parking building three times with no spot.  Ending up I had to use their valet.  Perhaps, this is to create jobs,  Tell our forecoming President.  I may be picky (you may say)  I'm half Jewish and I only do not eat pork or shell fish, besides due to my job, I see lobster and good food everyday, I did not have many choices of appetizer.  I picked steak tartar whatever but I did not like the taste as there was only meat taste.  I saw my friend order oyster that looked good.  We shared a porter house steak but he did not order any side.  (He was to pay and this was the first time eating out with him, I was observing.)  The meat was cooked to our choice - good.  For the others, wait till I go out with another friend and try again.  I see that the menu does have good items.  Good try.  The price???  Mummmm depending with where you want to compare. Feel like eating at Sheraton or Marriott Hotel.   It is pricey.  In California, you can get better price for this standard. But definitely, a place that you can show off a little bit if you are dating someone.  Haha!!  Overall, a place of class except the parking.  BTW, someone say casual dress, fortunately I always dress proper to any dinner.  Otherwise, I will be very embarrassed.  Perhaps the night I went there had lots of either company party or business people.  Sorry, am I too sarcastic???

_hJZ3cJegQPHL811Rx68Ng.text: Went for restaurant week this past summer. Food was good. Menu options were also good. Service was average, at one point a bus boy dragged a trash can right through the restaurant. Expected better brig a del friscos sister restaurant, but overall average. Good wine list.

QExPd-d5ZE6430SZJhI7rw.text: Great high quality steak house. I like the shrimp cocktail, large shrimp, with spicy sauce. The filet and lobster include a lettuce wedge and blue cheese. Yes, I know Sullivan's is a chain. The quality is high and consistent.

NP5Q6JwrWP5By5dg69AdMg.text: Props to a Solid Steak House....  Sullivans has a very dark and swank atmosphere giving off a very upscale vibe. This is a personal favorite will living in Charlotte. It was my first experience with the lettuce wedge with diced tomatoes, blue cheese dressing, and crushed black pepper - just plain awesome. Their are known for their steaks which are tremendous. Big fan of the key lime pie for dessert. The wait staff is attentive and personal. If you are visiting/living in Charlotte give it a try, you will be glad you did.

-6dlpbmVshAmEx6tFmncOQ.text: I have only been to this restaurant for the happy hour. It's wonderful! Flavorful, strong drinks and very flavorful food. The live jazz and dim lighting make for a great ambiance.

jB7_14UhDYihQjoa_jckzA.text: Our reserved table was ready when we arrived. Seated immediately, server approached us with a big welcome, ice water poured within 3 minutes. Drinks/bread/entrees all served quickly. Both of our steaks were a bit overcooked. Our server Lynn, as well as the manager offered us new filets but we declined because they were still delicious. Received a free dessert to make up for the filets. Excellent customer service, delicious food. Beautiful ambiance. Can't wait to go again.

BiD_ThL2-Ob-HRez8g5YPQ.text: I went to Sullivan's Steakhouse during restaurant week in Charlotte. I have to say the really do give you your $30 worth of food, unlike some other steak houses with the similar promotion.  I had the Cesar salad which was just what a Cesar salad should be. For the main course of coarse I had the fillet, that was cooked to perfection, dessert was the banana's foster bread pudding (worth going back for just that),  Our Waitress was wonderful. All the girls ordered a glass of wine and they were out of two of the options. The waitress came back with similar wines and charged the same price for the glasses. She also told them if they wanted something different to ask. This was a great move on her part, no one was without a drink the whole meal!  Overall great place, not sure about the regular prices, but $30 was perfect for me!

jampCANmd1y5V4jFqSGpmw.text: Visited for restaurant week. My family and i all ordered the filet mignon with soup or salad with a side of mashed potatoes and chocolate mouse for dessert. We also ordered a side of sweet potato casserole. Our experience: the atmosphere was very nice and friendly even on a busy Wednesday night for restaurant week. No issues with service. Ceasar salad was good but did not care to much for the shrimp and lobster bisque. I did not like the color or care to much for the flavor. The soup was just okay but would not get it again. Our steaks were prepared and cooked to perfection! The mashed potatoes were prepared with a horse radish which none of us cared for. I finished mine but my wife and daughter did not. The big hit was the side of sweet potato casserole which pretty much could be considered a dessert because it was so sweet and delicious. Desert was chocolate mousse. We compared the mousse to Mortons downtown where we dined on Monday. Both Mortons and Sullivan's mousse were delicious but my wife and daughter preffered Sullivan's and I picked Mortons mousse as the winner. I thought Mortons was richer and had more flavor. We will definitely go back and reccomend Sullivan's.

M_WoxhT6_B3gcZ6So0h_4Q.text: Sullivans is a classic - excellent food and superior service, anytime but restaurant week.

FiOwoiENdmq7D0f62txqxQ.text: Always good! We had a large party and our server was great! The food was fabulous as usual! If you want a good steak this is the place to get it! Definitely in my b top 5. Can't wait to visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

kQzTtOtxS6T9ROAwUlytFw.text: Awesome first time visit for Restaurant Week!! Our server, Morgan, had a great personality. The food was wonderful and everything was cooked perfectly. Every employee that we interacted with was friendly and positive. The ONLY negative thing was that there was a ton of gum under our table that I kept accidentally bumping, otherwise we loved it!!

O8mgHT685PENODbUu1Lscg.text: Great food. But service was awful. It took us 2 hours to get our full meal. We had a reservation and was told it would be 20+ minutes. What's the point in having a reservation then? Don't seat people who didn't have reservations, make them wait. We had to sit outside instead of waiting and the waitress had 6/7 tables; not her fault but they didn't have enough people covering the patio. It took way too long. Delicious food though so that's a plus.

g48PuZKmLkgvLLacKSM_kg.text: After many delicious meals at Sullivan's sister restaurant Del Frisco's we were super excited to kick off restaurant week to compare the two. Sadly the experience at Sullivans was below expectations the entire night.   We showed up on time for a 7:00pm reservation and were told they overbooked and we would have to wait. We headed to the bar where I had to flag someone down for a wine list. When our table was ready (not a huge wait thankfully) we were escorted to our small table packed in the middle of two rows of booths. Being able to hear conversations quite clearly all around us did not provide the atmosphere of "nice steak dinner".   The Caesar salad that we both got was large, and had too much dressing for my taste, and the croutons were chewy like they weren't cooked long enough. My filet medallions were cooked as ordered but the steak lacked anything to recommend it. The horseradish potatoes had a very strong flavor that overpowered the steak. The end of the meal was the best part - my chocolate mousse was delicious but the boyfriend said his cheesecake was lackluster.    Even with the special restaurant week pricing the meal wasn't well priced enough for the quality of food we ordered. The restaurant was dimly lit and felt completely packed. I know that restaurant week, especially on the weekend, is a busy time for a restaurant but if the food and atmosphere are so uninspiring on a discount why would anyone return to pay full price?

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy chocolate mousse
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet medallions with shrimp

osJIpmQRl4wYQRbQqxy-Hw.text: Came out to Sullivans for a holiday dinner treat and what a disappointment! The service was way under par , the table was left unattended for way to long, the food came out cold, wrong orders, sent back a plate of seafood that was toxic , from start to finish it was really bad.  The understaffing on Christmas was a huge error. Definitely will not be back - this was a an embarrassment to have my guests and I experience such a disaster. Walking in we should have known when we had several open seats at the bar and waited a good 15-20 min for a "hello may I serve you a cocktail?" It was wayyyy different than the old Sullivans we knew and loved - we will not be back anytime soon .

Jkar2npRULAcWkp55r_8RA.text: Yum!!!! We had a HUGE party last night/ 30 people.  Service was great.  The crab legs were so big and meaty!!! Filet was amazing and the side dishes were huge!

9ooYAYI8jkucJrI6C486Zw.text: The food was mediocre at best for the price.  My steak was not cooked properly and the side dishes were boring .

JRUj9qsDaWvUKGHoiBKnSw.text: Sullivan's has been a staple in Southend for the 20yrs I've been here. It was always a favorite for bar bites, service, music and friends. The last few times I've been here it's gotten less exciting. We got here tonight about 20min and just got service, we will see how the food is but I won't hold my breath. Service, well we knew they were annoyed when we came in an hour before the closed. Oh yeah we called to check and see the kitchen hours.

siUQz8tkP4kobt_JoRZ_7Q.text: I recently dined at Sullivan's with my boyfriend and it was a memorable experience to say the least. This is now one of my favorite steakhouses to eat in Charlotte. If you want a great dining experience with outstanding service and amazing food, this is the place to go. The price point is certainly not for conservative spenders, however for those that search for an overall experience rather than savings, will be rewarded with great service and delectable food. I look forward to my next visit.

VQTf_8gsACHeJhslaGrhbg.text: Had dinner here last night everything was excellent One thing when I called to reserve a table I asked about the Sunday special price supper and was told they no longer had that Much to my surprise when I received the menu from our waiter it also hav a special 3 course menu for a price of $44.00 each with a nice choice of items We chose that menu and everything was Excellent  The people that answer the phone should know this Not knowing may keep some customers from coming into this restaurant

J6i39t1UDEJdcJS3bQ5AWQ.text: I think I reviewed this already but....  You expect a great steak with great service to be a bit  expensive.  You get what you pay for.   There were 8 of us and we had reservations..  The service was great.  The food was great and the wine list was a book of great wines available at all prices.  I will be back to try their dry-aged bone-in rib eye.  All of us that the whole evening was wonderful.

4mfUZueyuPuJkUTBBfFSqA.text: I had booked on OpenTable and when I arrived on time, we were immediately seated to a table even though there were others waiting near the hostess stand. Awesome.  Looking over the menu, I had made my decision from the rather expensive listing of steaks and side dishes. That changed when our waiter - Matt, who was awesome - went over the evening's specials. Suddenly, the idea of a trio of small filet mignons was what I wanted and each with a different topping/sauce. Massive wine list but only a small list of beers and an even smaller list of local beers. In fact, just one. OMB Copper.   All three of us started with the wedge salads. These were good portions with plenty of blue cheese to go with the lettuce and chopped tomatoes. Not a bad deal for $4!  When they arrived, the steaks looked perfect. Three small filets, each in a different sauce. The first two, a bearnaise and an Oscar, I enjoyed thoroughly. Perfectly cooked and with the right amount of sauce on top. But by the time I had cut into the third one, it was no longer quite so perfect. More overdone than I ordered and a bit of a tougher cut, especially since the first two were so good. Bummer.  For dessert, I let Matt talk me into the bread pudding. It was... fair. Just not that great with not enough taste and some of the topping was over done. I wouldn't have this again.  On the pros list, no wait for a seat when we had a reservation, excellent service from Matt, a local beer choice, great salad, and great steaks.  On the cons list, the booth was a bit too tight for the three of us to sit comfortably. Perhaps another inch or two, please? Only one choice for a local beer. Most of the steaks were great and the dessert was only fair.  Complimentary valet parking is nice, as there is not much street parking nearby.  Sullivan's is a higher-end steak joint and works hard to earn that high dollar menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trio of steaks at Sullivan&#39;s

Zw73TAWYvR3F2X-NNjp6vA.text: First off, let me say that our waiter Chris was genuinely THE BEST waiter either of us have ever had. He was so amazing and attentive. When he asked what brought us here, we said we were visiting from out of town and heard good things. He went completely out of his way to make the meal special for us - he brought me a rose (although he claimed my man gave it to him to give to me;)), was super friendly and checked in on us throughout the meal, and gave us a free dessert to take home with us. He was literally the best and I can see why they put new servers with him! Secondly, the food - OMG. Amazing. Steaks are the best we ever had in our life! Try the New York strip with the bourbon peppercorn sauce - it was actually my date's food but I kept stealing bites! My filet was wonderful as well. The mashed potatoes were delicious and even the bread they give you as you sit is tasty too! And you must try the calamari as an appetizer! Chris recommended it to us and it was the yummiest calamari I've ever eaten. Honestly everything at Sullivan's is the best I've ever eaten. We live four hours away but we agreed we're making special trips to Charlotte for this steakhouse. We love Sullivan's!

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheesecake Chris sent home with us! Yummy midnight snack

uEvYOnT-YmjRV257cz-xeA.text: We received a gift card for Sullivan's from my brother in law, so we decided to give it a try. I mean I love to splurge a little on having a fine dining experience accompanied with a fine steak and glass of wine. The service wasn't bad if it was Carrabas prices. We walk in and immediately are greeted by three women chilling around the hostess stand talking, one of them then helps out and gets us seated. After being seated I look at the menu and am like ok, wow this seems like a high end steakhouse. AWESOME! I get giddy seeing the different types of steaks they have. We order aps, we get their egg rolls, not bad, but not great. Then we get our salads, lol guys, I've never had a ceasar salad where they don't chop the salad for you. Maybe it's classy now to be nibbling on 8in pieces of romaine, not sure so I could be wrong on this part of what's classy now. As we were eating our aps though, the table next to us had the manager come over and were venting to him for a good 10 min on the service. I couldn't make out what was going on as it was too loud but for sure they were not happy. Anyway I order the top steak they have which was $70 wagyu- medium rare, and my wife gets the filet mignon -medium. They bring it out and me and my wife take a couple bites, look at each other and are just like, this steak sucks. It took 5 minutes to chew and was not tender at all. Cooked like we said but just terrible meat, not sure if they froze it? Or they just gave us some sams club steak they got on discount and said it was wagyu or filet mignon.  I WAS PISSED. And just wanted to get out of there asap. My whole thing is that I paid a ton of money for crappy service and worse food. From sitting down to ordering ur food, and eating everything, we were in and out of there in 30 minutes.... I've eaten at Chick-fil-A longer than that. I want the experience, the waiters to actually know their stuff and educate me in the food THEY serve, instead of me asking multiple questions about the $70 steak I'm about to order that the waiter doesn't know much about. I want to be able to sit and enjoy a nice meal with my wife instead of being interrupted every 2 minutes with the waiter asking if we decided on something or them bringing out food. I've never complained about fast service, but when you're a fine dining restaurant I feel that you have to be aware to not rush your customers. And finally, all these other issues would have melted away if I had just received a mouth watering steak that melted in my mouth. No, instead my wife and I were chewing rubber, and utterly disappointed. I had outback steak last week that tasted better than that. Again, either you drop your prices to reflect your service and food, or pick your game up. Will never go to Sullivan's again, I felt violated after being screwed over in that place.

qmqWZsqvVDFG52rwli1Wag.text: Very disappointed in the quality of our steaks. We had the long bone ribeye, a cowboy ribeye and a filet bone in. We all commented on a lack of flavor and dryness of the meat.  We love good beef and we were excited to try Sullivan's. For a $400+ dinner for three it was mediocre at best. Hopefully we were the exception not the rule....

p3o6lDc5-IW4r6o3S9F7Eg.text: Wonderful food and service as always!  We enjoyed the Knockout, Filet, Salmon, Horseradish mashed potatoes and warm chocolate brownie tonight.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Knockout is my favorite!
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Warm chocolate brownie. You can tell we hated it. Lol

G709duZ8UlLotw2_AF8ung.text: Atmosphere was really nice. Parking great! FOOD WAS AWESOME!!! Yes Sullivan's was pricy but for the great  food and great staff.. it was worth it! I had the Sea Bass, it melt in my mouth like cotton candy(THE BEST BASS I HAVE EVER HAD!!)  and my husband had cowboy rib eye(in which he said it was "OK". PLEASE NOTE: All meals are A la cart. Drinks was pricey, $12 for house wine. I WOULD GO BUT BACK! Great place 5 stars from me!!

d1D8CAsnUKBMFO_DB78kGA.text: Knock out martinis are awesome!  $7 happy hour drinks on Wednesday- great deal.   Wait staff, Ericka, and others were friendly and helpful. Banana Fosters Bread was delicious - do yourselves a favor and try it.   Great atmosphere. Watching game, while listening to a live band. Wonderful place to be on a weeknight with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

FpdhzbmM10Yv_PLLaRcjVg.text: My birthday dinner was there and it had been a while since I'd been there. My steak was good however my potato needed help. Overall the dinner was delicious and I really enjoyed my pinapple Martini it was so smooth and delicious as I remembered. It was late and I had no desert but next time I will. My honey had a cowboy style steak and he enjoyed it too.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

LaNEia4vr7Dg4jRBHfRMrQ.text: I was taken here for lunch to celebrate professional administration day. We sat outside not realizing the black awning radiates heat.  Great for when it is cool, but a little too warm when it is 80 out.  The service was excellent. I had the seared ahi tuna and everyone else's food at our table looked amazing (Filet Mignon, Steakhouse Salad and Chicken Kale Salad).  I have a salt sensitivity so they worked with me with limited cajun spice and the sauce on the side.  We were all so very happy that we even got dessert.  Those desserts were to die for. The sales and event planner, Nichole Daniels, even came by our table to give us all a little gift for celebrating at Sullivan's.    I have only been here one other time and it was a little disappointing. I thought I would not come back, this visit has changed my mind and I am planning on bringing my husband for a date night soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger and Fries
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. S&#39;mores Mouse Cake
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peanut Butter Black Bottom Pie.

wtLPCAazaJitdlbng5cKRg.text: I took 3 of my coworkers here for dinner.  It was simply excellent and the service exceeded expectations.  No stuffy wait staff either.  The hostesses could act a little more interested.  Everything we had was excellent...  Shrimp Cocktail - excellent, huge, cocktail sauce so delish.  Caesar Salad - fresh, crisp, very tasty dressing but not overpowering.  Bread - warm, fresh, had to fight over last piece  Wine - excellent selection. I am not a connoisseur by any stretch but its a great offering.  Steak - of course, the steak... cooked to perfection and oh so amazing.  I ordered the filet.  Wow!  I skipped dessert.  Who has room after all the other stuff!  I did have a coffee.  It was well brewed, served hot.  About a week after my visit, I received a thank you card in the mail from our server and she remembered a couple of things about our conversation - like my recent visit to Switzerland.  A few days after that, I got a thank you card from one of the managers.  What a nice touch.

XzMR0nPANB-qSlirlyp6Dw.text: I went to Sullivan's for lunch today.  The food was pretty good- but the service had a lot of room for improvement.  I went in at about 12:30 PM and sat at the bar.  There were a few other patrons in the restaurant.  The bartender was friendly enough, but not overly engaging.  But it was clear that the servers did not have their collective act together today.  Here are a few examples:  1.  Although sitting at the bar, the food always came in on the side with someone literally scaring me the first time they presented food at the table. 2.  The bartender, from approximately ten or so feet away, called at me "do you want bread and butter?" 3.  The phone must have rang ten times before anyone answered it even though there was someone at the door (where the phone was located) who welcomed persons in. 4.  Even though I saw a bunch of other servers and the place was not really very busy, the bartender was serving and busing other tables instead of taking care of customers at the bar.  Don't get me wrong...everyone was friendly, but the service was below what you would expect of a restaurant of this caliber, and with fairly high prices.  The food itself was good.  I had a Caesar salad, salmon and mashed potatoes.  Portions were adequate, but not overwhelming in size.  But it all tasted quite good and I felt I got my money's worth.  My "go-to" high caliber, high-price steakhouse in Charlotte continues to be Capital Grille.  Sullivan's could learn a lesson or two from them.

ycHyv-8KI5AWJTkY8hVvJw.text: We went to Sullivan's June 18th for Father's Day and had a wonderful time.We had an 11:30 reservation in order to beat the crowd and it was well worth it. I'm sorry I don't have the waitress' name, but she was a blonde young lady who took perfect care of us, attending to our needs, but letting us enjoy our dinner in privacy too. We all used the Sure Thing menu and had the seafood bisque (the real deal with chunks of seafood you can see and taste), filet mignon, complete with mashed potatoes, Italian bread and creamy butter, and a choice of dessert ( cheese cake, key lime pie or banana pudding). All this for $44 a person. It was outstanding! Thank you Suliivans! And thank you to the new manager from Indianapolis who was on the job one day but still greeted all the customers!

x8x4MMJ0tb5Scxtpl46r0A.text: Previously, I have only been to Sullivan's to hang out in the cocktail area & order from the bar menu, but this review is for dinner in the dining room.    Now, generally, when I get to pick the place, my first choice would NOT be a chain restuarant, even an upscale one.  But, as it turns out, we had a gift card that could be used at either Del Frisco's or Sullivans. So, I went online to research menus ahead of time. Based on the menu (specifically the Ahi Tuna steak entree) I decided that we should go to Sullivans.      Needless to say, I was SUPER DISAPPOINTED to learn that they were out of Ahi tuna since that was the whole reason I decided to opt for Sullivans.  BUMMER!!  (I could see a smaller locally owned place running out of a popular menu item, but a huge corporate chain like Sullivans should have a better idea from their POS system about how much of certain items to keep on hand in the restarurant at any given time.)  So, I purused the menu to explore my options...sadly for those who don't eat steak (like me), the rest of the seafood or poultry options were not really exciting.  Oh well, c'est la vie.  But, as a small consolation prize, they had the Knockout martini on special for $6 (which normally is around $12)... so I started with that.  The knockout is made of clementine vodka that has fresh pineapple steeping in it for at least a week.   It was somewhat sweet, but not cloyingly so. I enjoyed it very much. 4.5 stars.   I decided to opt for one of the Sunday Prime-time specials.  For $34 a person, you can select one item from each of the following categories (however, beware, they have fairly limited options in each category):  (1.) Salad or soup,  (2.) An entree, (3.) A side dish, and  (4.) Dessert.  To go with my entree, I ordered with a glass of Sauvignon Blanc.  For $8, I got a fairly generous pour of an ok wine. 3 stars.   I started with the wedge salad.  3.5 stars.  The salad was huge and slathered with lots of bleu cheese dressing and a little finely chopped tomato. (At least they aren't one of those restaraurants that feels compelled to automatically throw bacon on everything.  I was glad this salad comes without.)  For my entree, I went with the salmon w/buerre blanc sauce.  The salmon was a decent size and thankfully was not overcooked. The sauce wouldn't have been my first choice if there were other options, but it tasted fine.  Overall, I would give this item 4 stars.   The side dishes on the special menu are very limited, and unfortuantely didn't include asparagus.  So, I went with the only other green option, the creamed spinach.  This dish was loaded with parmesan cheese and cream. It was ok, but I couldn't eat much of it because it was way too rich. 3 stars.   The dessert was fairly disappointing from my standpoint.  I love a good bread pudding, so I was excited about trying the Bannas Foster bread pudding.  This was made in individual ramekins and had a couple of slices of bananas in it.  It was also topped with ice cream, whip cream, and a drizzle of what looked like a carmel sauce.  Sadly, it was not very flavorful and the bread pudding had almost a rubbery texture. 2 stars.    David also got the wedge salad and chose the filet mignon for his entree.  He said the steak was over-salted.  He also chose mushrooms for his side and I tasted them - they were also a little over-salted. I couldn't eat more than a couple of these. For his dessert, he got the cheesecake to take home, since our server told us that we might want to split one dessert in house and take the other one to go (this  was a good suggestion because otherwise, it would be way too much!)  He also ordered a Highland Oatmeal Porter to go with his steak.   Our server was nice, but the service was only ok - not great. One small thing we noticed is that some tables had bread served to them and some (like ours) did not.  Since this was my first time eating in the dining room at Sullivans, I don't know if you were supposed to order the bread, or if the server just forgot to bring it.  (Not a huge deal, but it would have been a nice touch.)   Another small thing I noticed was no manager going around the dining room to greet patrons.   Overall, I was just not impressed given that our total bill came to $94 before tip.     I would come back here to meet friends for cocktails & casual bites from the bar menu, but I would not come back for a full-fledged dinner.  There are just too many other great restaurants in Charlotte to choose from at this price point.

f2N7-sXvEI9lyRWAmxGMbQ.text: Get to the Chase:  Pros: 1) Some dishes were amazing like the sea bass and bok choy with a soy glaze 2) Service is top notch 3) Very large room with plenty of space  Cons: 1) What pretends to be a swanky and posh restaurant, fails to deliver in the same level of quality in its food (ahi tuna was limp and mushy, had 3 different meat dishes but all tasted the same and were over-seasoned) 2) The restaurant is a clash between casual and dress-up...leaving you feeling a bit underwhelmed in a stuffy environment 3) Hosts at the reception lack the attention to detail and are too pre-occupied with whatever they're doing to notice when people walking into cloak rooms with the intention of the bathroom 4) Definitely expensive....$350 meal with 4 entrees, 2 appetizers, 1 dessert and a bottle of wine split between 4 people  Overall, a hit or miss. Great potential, some winning dishes, but overall not worth the money they demand.

mMppNgwxVr35-zB3Rakhhg.text: The food was excellent as usual at Sullivan's. The filet medallions were great and the bone in ribeye excellent. The banana foster bread pudding was the perfect dessert. Alex our server was very attentive. The manager Stephanie went out of her way to make party feel at home.

tjKr637Lv-8ZqRvMbJxl3g.text: Best restaurant in Charlotte!  Bar area was packed and fun with a lot of energy... it's a place to go at least once a week!

HSTg2zWjHnQmLSu3KmDOow.text: I had the lobster and steak; it was amazing!!  I was traveling but this meal made my trip more enjoyable.  Would have had 5 stars but the sides, lowest cost per side was $3, were pretty bland at times. We had 9 people in our group and 1 out of the 5 sides we got was good. The others was just okay; but that's not okay bc each individual side is its own cost.  That being said, I will definitely go back. Although it wasn't ordered, the MacNCheese side I was told is amazing.

FKURLGcKH8c7rvxQ8j7ytA.text: Sullivan's is a favorite of my boyfriend and me. Of course, we thought it would be most befitting to have family and friends join us for his college graduation celebration dinner at our beloved Sullivan's.  We (party of 6) sat in the outside bar/patio area. Our server Marissa greeted us and introduced herself. Orders were placed, etc... the appetizers FINALLY arrived, however we did not receive any eating utensils. Upon request a few were provided, but not enough to accommodate all at the table. One of our guests had to go and ask for their own utensils, which never arrived, the table just shared what we were provided.  After over an hour wait, we inquired about the entrees, in which a different waitress was sent over, to advise us that Marissa was new, and this was not the initial incident of customers complaining, meanwhile, we consistently saw Marissa pass our table, and delightfully served the surrounding tables. We also noticed the manager speak with an adjacent table, however he failed to address our concerns, only the replacement waitress. After over an hour wait, our entrees arrived. Those of us that ordered the sure thing menu option, did not receive our soup/salads, and some entrees were incorrect all together. Sullivan's was a total disappointment and embarrassment to my boyfriend and I, as we had raved about the restaurant, and it was HIS celebratory moment that was ruined. We have frequented this location and well as the Raleigh, NC location (we' meet former Charlotte Manager, Aileen, who is currently the Raleigh, NC manager) on many occasions, and have never had to succumb to this level of poor and disappointing customer service.  Our party left dissatisfied and without most of their meals (salad, desserts).

EoTpC0tnSYamNs-DtV63rA.text: Came here on Thursday for a few glasses of wine and apps for the first time. They were quick at moving people in and valeting their cars. Once inside they gave the gentleman I was with his beer Ina plastic glass because they were running a special, we immediately returned it and asked for a glass. The cheeseburger rolls melt in your mouth, they were delicious! We also had shrimp cocktail and crab cake, which were great. At the end of the afternoon the valet got my car in a matter of minutes. Very impressed and I will return.

LsoY0ZmCf8sUGEliXLEtvA.text: My review is only for the bar area. We did not eat in the restaurant.  Went here to listen to the jazz quartet and have dessert after a day out.  Dessert (I had the cheesecake, my companion had the chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream) was really good.  We had coffee and water to wash our sweets down.  Our waitresses (we somehow ended up with two) were great. They both checked on us often enough and kept our drinks refilled as necessary.  We wanted to sit where we could see AND hear the musicians so we sat near the bar at a tall table, close to the patio area.  Great seats except that a slight smell of smoke wafted in continuously during our visit.   The quartet was fantastic. Great classic jazz, uptempo as well as laid back sounds.   I think they're in the wrong time slot as well as a bad location in the venue. They are set up in a back corner area of the bar area, where I assume seating was removed. It does appear the only location for them to set up comfortably.  However, because there are tv's in the bar and most of the seating in the area has patrons' backs toward the musicians, it doesn't seem likely that the quartet is getting enough visual or audio notice from the crowd.  The majority of the folk I observed in the time we were there (until 10 p.m., the same time the live music ends), seemed to be mid-30s. The folk who might enjoy the music seemed to gravitate toward the bar area around the time the group was packing up to leave.  Shame.  As a previous reviewer noted, the attire of the ladies working at the location is a bit short and tight (and the fishnets give them an air of "Las Vegas showgirl", in my mind) but it all fits the pseudo-upscale vibe I got from the place overall.  I don't usually frequent the south end area but if I'm in the area on a night the musicians are there, I'll drop in for dessert again.

pNSpE9ZHQ9zwnCJCf0C26Q.text: Yesterday my husband and I went to Sullivan's to celebrate my birthday. He decided to take me there to try someplace we haven't been. We are regular "steakhouse " eaters at various known venues. What I noticed immediately is that the ambiance was wonderful and clearly it is a well visited place by many. I liked that we were seated in the back, a very private area where you could have a conversation. The service was impeccable and it was clear our waiter knew what he was talking about regarding wine pairing and preparation of a steak. My issue was the food. I was truly disappointed on many levels.  We moved to Charlotte from PA and we've noticed it is very difficult to get a Pittsburgh style medium rare steak. My husband had to send his steak back for another try. All of my food was way too salty. Whom ever ran the kitchen this evening was heavy handed with the salt to the point that I did not enjoy my dinner. My shrimp/lobster bisque, too much salt. The shaved Brussel sprouts. Too salty, The Chil encrusted rib eye, way too salty. What I enjoyed about my dinner were the mushrooms, just right and the Sullivan's reserve Cabernet.  Oh the key lime pie was tastey. The over abundance of salt not only took away the natural flavors of the food( that you missed) but would give a healthy person high blood pressure. One of the evening managers did come to the table and was sincere in his disappointment. We most likely because of this experience will not return to Sullivan's because there are other steakhouses that have consistent outcomes.

hzR75A51qnvKvDIRMUfquA.text: Not a fan on the bar food. The oyster did not look good. The steakrolls were soaked in way to much sweet stuff. The place smelled like a cigar lounge.

AXfU81kxPvae-5owuVc9wA.text: Our server, Lauren, was awesome.  She had great recommendations for beverages and dinner.  We were there celebrating our anniversary and had a great time.  We had the Filet feature with mac and cheese, creamed cheese (a must order!), gnocchi and mushrooms (there were too many great sides to choose from!).  We have eaten here many times and it has never disappointed.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone!  They brought us a complimentary dessert since we were celebrating.  Can't wait to go back again!

eug0vEu43mBy-7fpUpcxAw.text: I will never eat here again. I had ordered Medium Rare Ribeye. It was $44.00 and was cooked to medium. And was very very Salty.  I was offered another steak at no charge. It's a steak house, you have to get it right the first time. And I was not visited by the manager after complaining. Poor Customer Service.

Wwyb_6j4EvxrdZ8T2lsf9w.text: Food was delicious, service was awful. Took approximately 23 minutes just to close the tab. We were initially given the wrong meal, had to order drinks multiple times, and never received any check ins from the waitress. Additionally, when we ordered a glass of water while closing out our tab, we were told the restaurant had run out of everything, including water.

pNTbTV-_2xSy9ChW6juC4w.text: Today was my birthday. We had a quiet table at the end of the lunch shift. Our server, Shelly S, was especially attentive and upbeat. The steak salad I ordered was perfect; my husband thought his Cobb salad was the best he has tasted. Sullivan's is a special occasion restaurant - Shelley even took a photograph for remembrance of the day. She brought the framed photo to our table, inscribed with her words "sending love and light your way." How special is that?  Yes, incredible personalized service. We highly recommend Sullivan's Steakhouse in Charlotte, North Carolina.

fEerndA4i2cscakeKJgGQw.text: I frequent this place a lot. The filet will melt in your mouth!!! Great place for an anniversary dinner or other special occasions.  Staff is always professional and on the spot.  Might be a tad bit pricey for most people but well worth it.
