JjwfgDQVh_K0yLoh4IN_NA.text: I've been several times.  New Year's Eve 2013 most recent.  Bar can't make skinny margarita.  Oh well.  Steak was good but over salted.  Mushrooms over salted a lot but I liked them anyway.  The rest was great.  Chocolate covered strawberries were soooo good.   Surprised to see a visible layer of dust on wood rail next to our booth.  Not good.  Please clean well!!!  I'd go  back.

CTt3WNsg2GjEFQOs7qG09A.text: Fabulous food. Fabulous service! Best steak in Charlotte. The Cowboy cut steak is to die for. Highly recommend.

NYzldc931qH5EymCcsL9_g.text: We had a very disappointing experience last night. I took four of us to dinner for a 60th Birthday dinner. The server was new and 3 times referred to our occasion as an anniversary. She could not operate a wine opener and had to ask another server for help. She then forgot to order a dinner for two of us and we ate in shifts. We had to ask for hot sides for the two waiting since the other two had finished. To the credit of management they did comp a bottle of wine. I would have happily paid for it for a different experience. At the end of the day there are some of the best Steakhouse's in Charlotte. The competition of stiff. Sullivan's needs to step up their game and training program for wait staff. She wasn't ready.

wjAnlpJZ7n0XqGciebkrUQ.text: I give the restaurant a 3 based on what I would expect for cuisine and service for the prices on the menu.  Ate at the bar. Staff didn't seem to eager to get me a beverage or pay attention to me.  Steak was "ok."  Side of Broccoli was warm at best- was soon cold.  I just didn't feel the wow for the price.

tq3U9cxmLMf6Fl3V6WiVyA.text: Took my lady here for Mother's Day and I have to say this was probably the worst restaurant experience I've ever had. I won't go into detail for the fact that the manager (Sarah) did everything she could to correct the situation. THANKS SARAH. I will try this establishment again only because I appreciate the effort Sarah made to rectify situation.

mDCgeS6B9EBiEDP1uVDyuA.text: During church service my best friend and I (don't judge)  we're trying to figure out what we were going to eat for dinner, we remembered that it was restaurant week and every place we wanted to go to didn't have any reservations but i called and they were able to fit us right in. Everything from the water was outstanding, steak was seasoned well, the red wine blend was good and i don't usually drink red wine... i can't wait to go back

dVdpJk9EkU_rhjT8EFvPlA.text: I have been to Sully's many times for the Thursday live music, $7 apps and lemon blueberry martinis-- and have always loved it but, this time was even better! We had amazing service-- from three managers to two servers who were working our table outside while watching the Hokies game. They gave us free drinks and appetizers for having a tad long of wait, and I think each of them stopped over to us to chat a few times! Just really amazing service and made our experience so nice!

uzh1wD1D9UYYIu23RYJtVA.text: Brooke did such an excellent job! She was very thorough & knowledgeable about the menu. She also had some great suggestions and made our experience enjoyable. Thanks for your hospitality Brooke!

OyMVp0yO33NubI8FYA8Icg.text: Sullivan's has always been on my list for "must go to" restaurants/steak houses; they certainly didn't disappoint. its located in the South End of Charlotte and offer complimentary valet but honestly if the weather isn't bad, save yourself the wait and tight space and just park a block over, adjacent from the restaurant and simply walk over.  I took advantage of Queens Feast/ restaurant week. They were behind on reservations (the only reason why they didn't get 5 stars) I think we were seated maybe 15-20mins after our scheduled reservation.  for a starter the lovely waitress recommended the seafood sampler... which by the way was bonkers (Crab legs & claws/ Colossal shrimp/ Fresh oysters/ Lobster tails). its fairly pricey though ($60 smh)  The first course consisted of the Shrimp & Lobster bisque which was good. nothing mind blowing. For the main entree however, I go the 8oz. Hand-Cut Filet Mignon with  horseradish mashed potatoes and asparagus. I can honestly say that was one of the most delectable steaks I've ever had; it was cooked EXACTLY how I asked for it (medium) and you could literally cut it with a butter knife (I know because I tried and succeeded with little to no effort). I also added the signature Cajun butter on my steak with even more so enhanced the flavor that was already there. for dessert was both the New York Style Cheesecake (amazing w/ fresh strawberries) and the best Bananas Foster Bread Pudding I've ever had with Vanilla Ice Cream and Caramel sauce on the side. My date was literally trying to stab me with her fork because I kept attempting to steal a bite LOL.

2mQuGutMMFZcEfeprSCtFQ.text: My experience was a 1 star! My friend had Tuna and loved it. That was the saving grace for the 2 stars.  The ambiance was nice. They had comfortable booths and nice art.  It was too loud for a nice conversation. Our waitress was very sweet and accommodating.  Drinks were made well and had the perfect amount of strength.   Bread and butter - very good! They use Real butter!!  Green beans - Too salty Mac n cheese - Disgusting, tasted smoked Cream of corn - Only ok, I've had better  Tuna - My friend said, incredible!

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Valet!
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The outside!
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The inside!

2eLVpRYWwiwt3ow59fl6sw.text: Looking for the perfect date night or great way to unwind after a busy week? This is your spot. Sullivan's has a great wine and cocktail menu as well as live music on their patio on Friday nights. Their menu is vast but their steaks and seafood are must tries!  The staff is friendly and efficient and the manager on duty was attentive and made his way to each table to check in. This is definitely a place with top notch food and service to boot.

nYyQLwnvGs3MuuXKj5lMPA.text: Our Anniversary Dinner was lovely and the staff was friendly. They took our picture, framed it with a Sullivan's photo holder and they all signed it.  Our server was nice but distracted and not attentive: forgot plate request for bread and drink refill request and us for most of the time.   Thankfully Susan was there with her lovely butterfly necklace and smile to bring the plate, refill the drink, take the plates, and bring the desert.  Thank all for lovely visit!

uen0LOysd0ok9wtQxt5oEg.text: Worst performance in my 15 years of frequenting Sullivan's.   3 of 4 meals were inedible and sent back.   Meal was comped and gift certificates were offered but turned down.   I don't need gift cards for poor food.   Will not return

EiKfL8t7ONmTB5BRCRAGaA.text: For a year my husband and I ate at Sullivan's any Thursday we were in town, over 27 times according to my card. We really enjoy eating outside when the weather is nice...but we had to come early or the 'band' would set up and play. Oh my goodness...this guy makes my ears bleed. I cannot believe anyone wants to listen to that 'sound'.   And then April...oh my heavens...the WORST server on the planet. Seriously. We had a horrid experience after a positive prior experience, reported to the manager about it and from that point forward, she was a nightmare for us anytime she worked and we were there. We started doing dining room only because she made the time in the patio or bar so uncomfortable.   Natasha is an AMAZING server--always ask for her!  Mike and Mary are FABULOUS managers who rotate through the restaurant and make sure things are great...but oh that April...she's a pill and frankly, the reason we have not returned in 2016. Which saddens me because it's otherwise wonderful, but having the stink eye anytime she's there is a big negative for us.   The food---GREAT! Parking--okay, not a fan of valet services so self-parking = a little bit of a hike Dining room--wonderful ambiance Bar--great drink menu Desserts--PHENOMENAL

_OOKIFm0jlisKSqdE-UZSA.text: Made a reservation for 7:15 PM to celebrate our wedding anniversary with my wife. Got there with 5 minutes to spare. Waited about 20 minutes before we were seated. For starters we got sat in the very back of the restaurant. There were chairs stored 5 feet away from us.  Our waitress finally shows up to take our drink order. Ask for a wine list, that took 15 minutes. Finally get our drink orders in, I get a pale ale while my wife is still looking at the wine list only to receive a Hefeweizen. 10 minutes later the waitress strolls back around. We take advantage of this, and put our food order in, as well as drinks. Another 20 minutes roll by and I finally get the correct beer and my wife her wine. 20 minutes later my wife's salad comes. She finishes it. Finally at 09:15 PM - two hours after my reservation time I've had it. Call the manager over and tell him to cancel everything and we left. I wanted to treat my wife to a nice dinner and Sullivan's decided to ruin it. Never again.

7htAJ01enunKY9Z420OJqA.text: Dinner at Sullivan's Saturday, December 15th.  Had a 7:15 PM reservation for a party of four.  We were seated 35 minutes late.  They failed to bring one of the drinks we ordered.  They did not have any Cowboy ribeyes.  Three of us had ordered the Cowboy ribeyes.  They did not have the scalloped potatoes.  They did not have the ingredients for a house drink that we ordered.  Our waiter would disappear for long stretches of time.   It was not a good experience.  No plans to return.

5dBqKREbRtzPI3Yoo-gEBw.text: So we made our way to Sullivan's again for restaurant week... for the 2nd time this week. Lol. Again, fantastic. Wife and I pretty much did the same. 8boz filet, med. Wedge salad, and she does the cheesecake, I do the Bananas Foster (a must try). And again, even with restaurant week, no drop in quality or service like we've seen at a few places. Sullivan's remains our favorite in Charlotte.

SnKAA6BIY5XGf4qLi8_-iQ.text: It's been a couple years since our last visit. Not as good as we remembered. Service was fine - think our server was fairly new. No offer to decant a 2008 Insignia.  Steaks were great but you had to get an 8 oz filet - nothing smaller The shaved Brussel sprouts were really good.  We sent the au gratin potatoes back as they were cold. The replacements were fine and tasty The ambiance was noisy.  They charged a corkage of $25. Most high end steakhouses only charge if it's on their menu. We weren't even offered or provided a wine menu. Overall we prefer Ruth's Chris uptown as the service is much more attentive and the environment is not as noisy.

jJ6xFVjV2d7ikpTD3fP_cg.text: The restaurant smelled of smoke. It was very hard for us to enjoy our dinner. I was disappointed that the manager never came over and addressed the issue. Our clothes smelled of cigar smoke. We were very disappointed.

gdtjnUYNMflhleuM2xYW6Q.text: Sullivan's is situated in the trendy South End location in Charlotte. They offer complimentary valet which is the best bet as parking can get tight.  I love the ambience and decor in the restaurant. Classical music played in the background that was nice to my ears as I felt like I was in another world.   Chris the waiter was great! He was very detailed, attentive and didn't miss a beat.   My meal consist of lobster bisque soup for my starter, salmon rockerfeller (bernaise sauce, crabmeat and bacon) for my entree and strawberry cheesecake for dessert. Ummm! The salmon was so flavorful, my taste buds were pleased! I had horseradish mash potatoes as my side and it was delicious. This is one of my top places to eat in Charlotte.

dnm5X0xqC75F8OH-3E8lvQ.text: Last night I went with a group of friends to Sullivan's Steakhouse for a birthday dinner. It's definitely a nice place to go to have dinner. The food was ok, I just think it's not worth the price. The Caesar salad is just a big piece of lettuce with Cesar dressing which kind of disappointed me. I ordered the salmon which was good but small, with the asparagus which was not seasoned. Now I will say that the cheesecake is amazing. Another thing was we ordered champagne and the glasses were dirty. The waitress had to go back three or four times to get clean ones. She was a nice lady, she even saved us some money by showing us a deal. After we was done eating we were ready to pay, the waitress took almost 45min to bring us our ticket and even longer to check us out. Other than that it's a nice restaurant, just over priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

JyS9JYFL-CkJjOwDkKfA8w.text: A private reserved party of 23 on March 2 2019. Drinks were good and nice atmosphere, however the food took 3 1/2 hours to come out. Not only, did it take so long, but also most people orders in our party was incorrect.  The food was average nothing special. The manager didn't come and check on anything it wasn't a good experience. The likelihood of me coming back is slim to none.

hlGIgS1R7x0cMJ28koMMAQ.text: This is a great all around place. I love the dining room because everything is delicious but my favorite is the bar.  I like to go there since they have a great Happy Hour menu between 5-7 nightly and all night on Thursday. The menu includes sliced steak, salmon and a killer hamburger. The staff is always fantasic and friendly. I like to eat at the bar and on nights when it isn't too busy the bartender will keep me company. If you don't mind sweet girly drinks, you have to try The Knockout Martini. It's a fantastic blend of pineapple and vodka and 1 or 2 will do the trick. On Thursdays the Knockout Martinis and select red/white wine is $5. That's a great deal.  If you are looking for a good Sunday deal, eat in the bar from the Sunday Prime Time menu. You get a full meal with dessert for a reasonable price. During Queen's Feast Week they also do a great meal for $30 but that tends to get so packed you may have to wait for a later seating. I would recommend going earlier when the restaurant starts serving and eating in the bar. I've never had a problem getting dinner there on nights other than Thursday. Thursday is their specials night and tends to become more of a "Singles Bar" feel. Every night except Sunday there is live Jazz in the bar. I can't help but love this place!

cWCi-uUKk96LG2GqzFemZQ.text: As far as steakhouses go, I'd say this place is in the middle.  Service was great, but food was nothing memorable.

6TtYxSlSyiFJG7Sic9bz-A.text: This is my #3 steakhouse in Charlotte and yes, for me, it's still 5 stars. You might say I've never been to a steakhouse I didn't like, but that would not be True, as there are a few out there. Sullivans has a great bar area w/music and a cool outdoor patio open year round. Can't beat the specials on Thursday & Sunday nights. Sunday they do their $30 3-course meal along with $5 Knockout Martini, which is similar to the stoli-doli at Cap Grille. Same drink special on Thursday with cheap bar bites.   The menu is awesome and the wine list extensive. I always order the filet and onion rings...yep, great combo. Wine or scotch...or both?! Great for special occasions or just a late meal. Try it on a Sunday...always busy after Panthers games.

u2Y2b4n7zuVpAiBaUX9Xxg.text: It was Charlotte Restaurant Week, so it still took us 20 minutes to be seated with a reservation... The hostess was pleasant, so it didn't put me in a bad mood... Our server was funny, attentive and knowledgeable... I love the wine list because you can order by bin number and not have to stumble your way through an order... (I can recognize a brand and a label but I am horrible at pronouncing some of the names... lol) The Caesar salad had just the right amount of dressing... I don't normally eat shrimp, but the ones that came with this NY strip steak were phenomenal... The steak itself was also very well prepared... I ordered it medium well and that is exactly how it came to the table... Just the slightest bit of pink and a nice texture... The mashed potatoes were pretty good and the vegetables were just basic... Luckily my boyf doesn't eat desserts, so I always get to try at least two for CRW... Last night's options were a Bananas Foster bread pudding and a chocolate mousse... I couldn't really get down with the bread pudding, but my friend seemed to love it... The mousse was a great way to end the meal, though!

i6RtTk9ZcIy7Zp44pwihAw.text: Good food, drinks and atmosphere. The Knock out pineapple martinis are amazing as well as their wedge and the scallops. The happy hour is great for afterwork get togethers. And don't miss out on sitting on the patio when its a nice night out.

MqP2lldzz5Q098FwkDCUcQ.text: I used to go to Sullivan's several years ago when Southend was just getting going. I wanted to take my son out for a special dinner last Friday to celebrate his new summer internship. Thought it would be good to try Sullivan's again as it is pretty close to my home in Dilworth. Made the reservation on-line which was by far the best part of the experience. It went downhill from there.  First, I was annoyed they called me to make sure I would honor my reservation. What am I supposed to do, drop everything and give them a call to let them know I would be there?  Second, the place smelled like a urinal cake.  I felt like I was dining in a porta-potty. Third, the hostess felt my son and I should dine in the back private room rather than the main dining room. We were dressed appropriately and the place was not crowded. We did complain and they moved us to the main dining room. Fourth, the staff rushed us through the meal and they were flat out rude. The food was okay, but not distinguishable from other top steak houses. Wine list was overpriced compared to Bonterra Wine Room for same bottle of red. For the price, folks are better off at The Capital Grill, Flemmings, Beef'n Bottle, Ruth's Chris, or The Palm depending on your location.

Uv_ldF4b7NOdmBgh0eNp1Q.text: A few friends had sworn up and down Sullivans was cheaper and better than other quality chain steakhouses we carnivores adore. As the much beloved, highly anticipated QC restaurant week is off the starting gates, Sullivans is the first stop in this possible gout inducing road trip of gluttony that would make Henry the VIII envious.   First impressions aren't much to gloat about. While calling for a reservation, I was told 8:45 was the next available spot. After having to confirm with my dinner mates, I had to wait on hold for ohhhh only a measly 7 or 8 minutes. Hmrph, lets try this again. Hung up and redialed, new person and now it's 8:30; uh okay that works, lets roll on out!   Upon arrival, complimentary valet - not too shabby. We had to wait a few minutes to be seated so, "please enjoy yourselves at the bar and listen to the live jazz band." I can dig it, dirty martini time! At only $10 for house vodka, oh Sullivans you sly dog, I like you already.   Bingo! Our names were called to be seated and after you wait for the hostesses to finish gossiping amongst themselves and finally seat you, the adventure begins. The dining room is lined with booths and a nifty library looking room adds to the Chicago, Dick Tracy-esque decor. The booths though, don't really sit 4 people comfortably.   Since it's restaurant week, the $30 meal is offered along with a "Summer of '69" for two which has slightly different options and two sides. Apparently its offered all summer and cost $69, heh go figure.   Summer of 69 it is, with asparagus and crab fried rice as sides. While the crab fried rice is pretty tasty, the asparagus was itsy bitsy, teeny tiny. Salmon is pretty tasty and very buttery - meaning good salmon.   Now, on to my carnivorous inner caveman. The filet; I loved it, but am upset at the chef. The steak itself was way too heavily over salted. Once you cut through the Bonneville Salt Flat crust though, what a mighty fine, tender, flavorful piece of meat. The key lime pie for dessert wasn't key to the meal, but was limey.  Service was great, the waiter was on top of his game and while the overall meal wasn't top notch, Sullivans is pretty smooth. Since it's a slightly cheaper date, I hope to visit more often. I just hope next time the chef doesn't take out his pent up frustration on the salt shaker.

TiT2pXmOGM275x7yM6GRaA.text: This place has really gone downhill. Ate there last friday. Waitress had no clue about menu. Could not ring drinks in properly. Food was okay but service was below mediocre

Nsk6U9G-o7MZEEMLUxNtag.text: As a self-proclaimed foodie I naturally get very excited when Queens Feast arrives a couple times a year. I am one of those people who peruse the menu before the week even begins and plan out exactly where I am going several days in advance. Considering many of my friends are of the vegetarian variety I was really craving a long-overdue steak.   Sullivan's was convenient for its South end location, and we were able to get a nice reservation time to fit our schedule. I was impressed with the ambiance overall. It was cozy, very classy, and interesting. Photos of boxers align the walls and a large wine vault (mmm wine) displays their vast collection.   We were greeted right away by very friendly staff. The Malbec I ordered was delicious - but I could see the wine list being slightly intimidating for new wine drinkers as it looked more like a novel than a list. We then received our bread which was very difficult to cut (we even heard the couple next to us say the same thing) and overly flaky but overall it tasted fresh.   We decided to order the $30 Restaurant Week Menu but they had similar Summer of $69 (for two) menu that seemed to be a great deal as well. I started with just a classic Caesar salad (I have a thing for them) which tasted good but definitely wasn't anything super amazing. Next, I had the Filet with Horseradish Mashed Potatoes and Green Beans. The steak and beans were cooked wonderfully but I felt the potatoes could have used a little bit more of the Horseradish flavor. Overall the dish was excellent and definitely satisfied my hunger for a steak! Finally my date and I shared our two desserts Banana Foster Bread Pudding (WOW!) and the Chocolate Mousse. Both were very good but the Bread Pudding was a stand-out.   I want to try some other steakhouses in the area since Charlotte has a plethora of them but I would definitely recommend Sullivan's - it was very good!

zrfuNeol0GkaI6z94sEkaA.text: We had an early dinner here last night before the game with my two boys and their buddy. After making reservations I read some reviews, I picked a few excellent and then read the 2 poor and 3 terrible to get an idea of what could go wrong. Usually it's either a simple mistake or a staff looked at someone which they perceived wrong and they cop the "I'm the big paying customer attitude" when in fact the staff probably was clueless to the perceptions and still has no idea unless they read the review! I found this to be the case with these, don't get me wrong, service is important but if you start your review off with "The food was well-prepared and tasted good", there could possibly be a problem in the mirror! We had two cowboy ribeyes, a filet and sea bass. All plates were well prepared, good looking, and great taste. One of the first things you notice is that there are no salt or pepper shakers on the tables. This can be interpreted two ways; you choose. I strayed a bit from my usual French onion soup and got the butternut squash soup with cream and pumpkin seed. It was delicious but a little too sweet for my taste so my 16 year old finished it off. I ordered a house salad to get some acidity to counter act the sweet and it worked out well. Steaks came perfectly cooked, and looked amazing. My wife and I recently went to Flemings and the ribeye they served didn't look half as good as this one. Matter of fact the bone in at Texas Land and Cattle looks better than the Flemings steak. My son's friend also had the cowboy ribeye and his too looked amazing. It just makes for a better meal when your first impression is "wow; that looks good". The other dishes were well plated also. We accompanied the entrees with creamed spinach and steakhouse prepared mushrooms, both well prepared with sharp flavors.  Service, where most people had their problems, wasn't ours at all. The service couldn't have been better. Our waitress was kind, professional, and presented herself and Sullivan's with class. She wasn't overly attentive and didn't disappear for long periods, just right. Kudos to Katelin, we appreciate her professionalism and kindness in her service. She alone pushes the final rating to excellent. Go to Sullivan's and enjoy a great meal

uA22YpobSvCECd6erjwOnw.text: My husband and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary there last Saturday.  The food was spectacular and the service was second to none.  Our server Luke was the absolute best!  Can't wait to return.

6-FM08NDmWQ5p92aSIsKvg.text: I personally don't think you can find better steak in Charlotte.    I've been to Capital Grill and found it overrated.  For great True quality, I always go to Sullivan's.  They have the best Ahi Seared Tuna, Blue Cheese Wedge, Steaks and some phenomenal desserts.  We tend to get the Filets but sometime is go for the Cowboy Bone-In Ribeye.  I highly recommend the Gorgonzola Butter on top of either!  Sometimes they put too much but it's an easy topping to rake off if you prefer small amounts.  Also, the sides... I had the Cream Corn this weekend for the first time and it was crazy good.  I love the Baked Potato with some fresh chopped bacon.  You get so used to the basics with that side... but to have it done right really makes you realize what you have missed in it.  It's fantastic.  Sometimes we can get the Souffle but often get the Brownie.  It's 'souffle like' with it's baking dish and is always moist.  Just remember to save some of that red wine to have with this dessert!    To those who left 1 Star : I challenge you to actually go and experience Sullivan's for what they are known for.  It's hard to go in and judge a restaurant based on their lowest priced menu and trying to get out on $20.  Experience it for what they specialize in.  A bar menu is meant to be that... it's a bar menu.

RrL8OvToV0Qo2DJW4vJ7ow.text: A vegetarian in a steak house!  Yes, it can happen.  My omnivore husband ordered their three course special:  calamari, the wedge salad, and beef medallions, which came with two shrimp and mashed potatoes. I chose the wedge salad, which, happily, did not come with bacon, horseradish mashed potatoes and creamed spinach.  First, we were greeted with a hunk of bread that could have lasted us for a week.  I ate the jalapeno slices from my husband's calamari, which were simultaneously hot and sweet.  The blue cheese dressing on the wedge was a tad sweet for my taste, but topped with yummy blue cheese and fresh tomatoes.  The freshly ground pepper cut the sweetness of the dressing.  I could taste the nutmeg in the spinach, which was topped with a scattering of Parmesan.  The mashed potatoes were creamy, and I could taste the horseradish.  Although I could sense the apprehension our waiter felt when he realized that he was dealing with a vegetarian, he recovered from his surprise quickly and delivered impeccable service.

dZfxLMX_hUZudt4kgZ0TqQ.text: I took my parents for restaurant week, as they just moved to the area. We waited 45 minutes for a table, even with a reservation. Our meals were good but our waiter was for some reason short and somewhat curt with us (my friend dining with us used the word "snarky," which is also fitting). It felt like he didn't really want to be there, and certainly not serving us. I wish we had gone to Capital Grille instead, I find they always treat you like royalty.

OEZOT_iqU2cnij3MdH0XEg.text: Went for lunch with coworkers. Not the best experience. A little pushy with their service and food. Needed many water refills because they just kept adding more ice to my cup than water. Ordered the fish tacos and immediately after the first bite my stomach was rumbling. Coworker also felt that their salad was overdressed and did look too heavy. Another coworker complained about the steak not being cooked right. I did not try the desert because my stomach was still not happy with my entree so I couldn't tell you how the desert tasted. The table was not an even surface, but of course was draped nicely in white cloth to cover, so I had to constantly adjust my glass on the table so it wouldn't spill. The chairs were too heavy and took up too much space. Music in bathroom was too loud. Location is inconvenient to pull out from.  Overpriced and overrated. I will not return and will not recommend.

6Q2EqD7ZaBVkGXUus4xwEQ.text: I have eaten here 4 or 5 times when in town. The food and service are always very good and I have never had a bad meal here. The steak is always cooked perfectly and has good flavor. The mac and cheese and various vegetable sides are always good. The potatoes can be salty at times but still decent.  The atmosphere is pretty good although the dining room is a bit crowded at times. The service has been attentive and pleasant each time without having the kind of snobbishness you sometimes encounter at a good steakhouse. They have been genuinely fun and helpful every time.  I have had better steaks but Sullivan's has been consistently very good and I would recommend it to anyone looking for steak in Charlotte.

5buao3sPJC5cDTCsE9ZcMQ.text: My go to place in Charlotte. I think it is the best steak in town. The lounge area is well done and the bar menu is fantastic if you're not in the mood for a massive meal. Always a pleasant crowd and the service is excellent.

wPBq8Ytn30IxC759HaB5WA.text: I decided for queens feast 2013 my friends an I would try Sullivan's .  I was blown away with the food an service .  First I started with the shrimp an lobster bisque soup lots of shrimp n lobster no holding back it was a creamy flavor that made me wanna pick the bowl up n lick it lol I ordered the 10 oz NY strip w mashed potatoes w/ broccoli an I ordered the Cabernet goat cheese butter an they gave you 2 jumbo grilled shrimp wow The steak was amazing flavor from the grill to a great cut of steak but the Cabernet goat cheese butter just melted so beautifully on top of my steak mmmm I was dragging my shrimp through the butter . As if I had any room left but than I went for desert lol I ordered the bananas foster bread pudding w ice cream oh my goodness it was so good and I'm not a bread pudding fan lol. The bread pudding was served warm n lots of bananas on it an the edges were good an crispy which I loved .  I will for sure be visiting Sullivan's again an all my friends enjoyed their meal the chicken picatta with capers amazing . If you get a chance go to Sullivan's an the staff were polite an didn't rush us.

ALJpwnfyI81oB4tVtNiTZw.text: Since this is a Steakhouse expect it to be pricey.  Wine is expensive in all restaurants by the bottle so bring your own and pay the 25 dollar corking fee. Before they recently changed the menu the Salad use to come with the steak but that is not the case any more. The Sides are good for groups so share some. Sides to try is Mac and cheese with bread crumbs on top , Creamed corn, Garlic Mashed. I usually get the Filet or the Chicken even though it's a steak house. It's very tasty. The Chocolate moose is good but it's seasonal dessert. If you aren't up to spending the money try the Pre fix menu or wait for Restaurant week since they have great dishes to try for a great price.

4ZbYSrPoloVJWqK8XTZeFA.text: I contacted Sullivan's ahead of time to let them know I would be proposing.  They went out of their way to save us a choice table!  The manager came out to personally congratulate and give us free champaign and dessert.  Now to the food review.  WOW!  The filet was incredibly tender, juicy, and delicious.  They did a magnificent job of giving the filet just enough seasoning to still allow the flavor of the steak itself to shine through.  The sides and dessert were to die for.  We loved the atmosphere and decor!  What a romantic place to go for an excellent dinner.  Don't forget to leave the kids at home ;)

9X9SP93Uts6ZDircwFln2w.text: What a disappointment! My wife and I decided to take advantage of restaurant week and enjoy a steak dinner from a very reputable restaurant. This was our first time to Sullivan's and maybe things are typically different, but from start to finish things were not good. Our waitress said we would have bread delivered to our table shortly (I'll come back to that), she would arrive back to our table every 15 minutes or so long after our glasses were empty, our steaks were not top grade steak that you'd expect from a steakhouse like this, our cheesecake was room temp. And our server did nothing! At the end of the day, if your establishment is going to partake in restaurant week please give those coming out to enjoy your food an opportunity to get the real experience. Don't turn your nose up at us, don't provide us with less than the best quality of meat you serve your patrons the rest of the year. I can provide you with a 100% guarantee that I will not return to your restaurant as I was embarrassed that my date with my wife turned out so poorly. So about that bread. I know this will blow your mind, but it never came. Just like the rest of the night it was a complete joke!

V6252RVtmMu0q_L7sg55Kg.text: We live very close to Sullivan's and have eaten there on numerous occasions. Some have been amazing and some not so great. In the past few years' we've made it a tradition to visit on Christmas Eve to 'treat' ourselves to a night out before the busyness of the next day rolls around.  This year we were happy to see they were not very busy even tho we were told on the phone they wouldn't be able to serve us. It's always me, my significant other and a single friend with whom we share our holiday eve with. We sat in the bar; the service was phenomenal. We thought the bill was pricey even with a $25 gift card, but we were cool with it.   We all shared the Calamari which was wonderful. My SO and I shared the filet/lobster tail entree, both of which were not very tasty. The lobster tail was so bland and came without butter. Our friend enjoyed his ribeye. We shared two vegetable sides, mushrooms and garlic mashed potatoes. The shrooms were average and the mashed potatoes were flavorless.  Coming away, we feel as if the quality/flavor of the food has really declined since our last visit and I felt a need to leave this message here.  We love our neighborhood spot and our holiday tradition, but not sure if we'll change it up next year or not.

JDiFklYRHCyNWXUKPoqOqA.text: Amazing all around dining experience. Staff was knowledgable about the food and very friendly. Best steak I have had in a long time, plus Mac & cheese with lobster side was outstanding. I will definitely return!

tIOcWVchHi6Zd6NPK_KpzA.text: Sullivan's lives up to it's name here, for the most part. The seared ahi appetizer was very flavorful, just the right amount of spice. The meat consistency was a little off, but the abundance of flavor made up for this minor detail. The deviled eggs, while as good as a deviled egg can be, I'd not worth the $9 for four halves. French onion soup is exquisite, and the wedge salad is perhaps the best I've ever had. The bleu cheese dressing is absolutely spot on and plentiful.  Peppered strip streak, medium-rare, cooked perfectly and tastes very good. The filet, also some to perfection, was hit or miss. One tasted so-so all the way through, the other had the gristle still attached and was half decent, the other half very good. All sides very good, mac n cheese, mashed potatoes, potatoes au gratin, shrimp cocktails. Desserts tried, key lime pie, apple crumble, and cheesecake were all excellent. However, the key lime did have mixed reviews. All in all, service was impeccable, the atmosphere is just a little loud (however the place was packed), meats overall very good, and will return if in the area again. The Kansas City Sullivan's is better steak-wise; however, the 5-star is still earned here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Key lime and apple crumble

vqSQWKqr4JuUwh8F-CE1sA.text: Very mediocre at best. The waitress Tara was horrible. Very inconsistent throughout the whole entire dining experience. The wait time for food was extremely long but never once did she ensure us that the food was coming and checked on the table. Once we voiced our concerns she became a little apologetic by telling us she was trying to find a table that skipped their bill and how she had a $200 tab with this table. Clearly she was more concerned about that scenario than getting her manager involved and taking care of the table right in front of her helplessly looking for their waitress. On top of her horrible service, a service assistant told us to ease up on her because she is only here for 2 weeks because of a situation with her daughter. On top of that we never did anything to this poor woman other than inquiry about our dinner service, only one round of drinks orders because she wasn't present. Also no manager ever touched our table he walked passed several times never inquired about our dining experience. We were celebrating a birthday instead it was overshadowed by tara family issues and other things.

9RFrH4lEjqUlaKoXO0AZsA.text: Dress nice when you come for dinner there is a bar area in case you feel a little under dressed. The steak is amazing here and I always choose to add the goat cheese butter to the top of my medium Rare steak because I feel like it was sent from heaven! The Oysters Rockefeller is good but one serving is never enough for me. The wine menu is extensive and in my opinion I don't like the pineapple martinis (never have) but the bartender here knows how to make an awesome mojito which in this town seems difficult.

LJf6OqKiBzz2bQO4iPk3bw.text: I've been to fine establishments but this was nothing special and WAY OVERPRICED.  They nickel and dime you for everything.  For the Bearnaise sauce on the steak ....$3 ..... a diet coke .......$3.50 and so on and so forth.    The steak was good but nothing that I couldn't get somewhere else for less.  We didn't get out of there for less than $130 and that is just plain ridiculous!  That left a bad taste in my mouth.  Yes, I knew to expect pricey but it wasn't that worthy.  I will choose other places in the future.

9nDF9ciKF5Dlh3FzwEuQLQ.text: Was seated as soon as we got here and service was excellent as not a glass remained empty the entire time we where here. Food was excellent, fresh and hot and all was cooked the way I like it. Another plus was the fresh and strong coffee.

3wx1m5j8n7ajz8doXQonAw.text: My husband and I ate here last Thursday and I was excited to try Sullivan's because I've heard great things about it! It started off great. Our waiter was great (I want to say his name was Ken but I'm not positive). Anyway, I ordered the salmon plate (super yummy) and my husband ordered the steak that was on special that night. Everything was great until a waitress brought us our food. She asked my husband to cut open the steak to make sure it was cooked to his liking (medium rare). He cut it open and looked inside but the restaurant is SO dimly lit that he couldn't see. So he was pulling out his phone and telling her that he was going to turn the flashlight on to make sure it's cooked properly. She didn't wait for him to do that and instead bolted. Our waiter came by to check up on us as my husband was checking the steak with his phone flashlight and it was literally mooing. I mean, it was basically just seared on the outside and completely raw on the inside. Moooooooing. So our waiter took it away, they put it back on the grill to get it cooked through a bit more and returned with it a few minutes later. Ok so, three things: I ate my entire meal alone cause I'd rather not eat cold salmon by the time they returned with the cooked steak. Second: they just stuck his steak back on the grill. Not a new steak. For the prices we pay there, I expect a new steak. Third: the manager came back with the cooked steak and simply apologized for the mooing steak. I expected that we'd be comped in some way. Or a free dessert. Or just anything to make up for their terrible mistake. But no. Nothing. Nothing was done to truly correct their error. We didn't have any time to speak with anyone or fight anything cause by the time dinner was over, we had to be at a ballet in 15 minutes. It was a little disappointing that at a nice restaurant, they can't comp a meal when they made a big mistake and caused us to not even be able to eat our dinner together. That's a big deal to us because we NEVER get to go on dates (parents of two babies). And we only get to eat dinner together twice a week. So we'd like to eat together when we get to go on a raaaaare date. Anyway, needless to say, it was a disappointment. Food was good but the lack of action on their part was a little crappy. Not sure if we'll ever return.

lT2dgKPl-hQJ6p6veik0vA.text: Sullivan's I like you. I think we'll always be friends with benefits and maybe even date, but I don't want to marry you and commit to you and only you for the rest of my life. There are just other steakhouses that mean a whole lot to me. I hope you understand.  Sullivan's is like a good friend to me - consistent, present and convenient. The steak and sides have always been solid and the patio is perfection on a warm spring evening. The staff is typically friendly and efficient - even when things get pretty hairy on a Thursday or Sunday evening when the major specials are available. Which leads me to those specials...as Todd W mentioned - Thursday offers $5 Knockout martinis and bar bites while Sunday typically offers a $30 per person three course meal. The Knockout martini is my jam, friends. This pineapple-y, vodka with a touch of orange concoction is my personal nectar from the gods. Get one or four...and find a designated driver.   The dining room is much quieter so if you're looking for a romantic or focused business evening, make a reservation. I fully appreciate Sullivan's consistency and the South End location doesn't disappoint. Thanks, friend.

TKhB5nRr96QFm18vvSJ-sw.text: My husband and I went there for dinner. It was recommended by the hotel. I personally don't like the fact hat you have to purchase everything separately. I expected he food to be much better than it was for the prices. Staff was not very friendly.  Expect more from a place that is suppose to be high end

UXP-GS5qMbDAncQO__RkgA.text: Sullivan's is Great.  I like the dark setting and the boxing decor.  This was probably my fourth time here and I just noticed a serious old school boxing championship belt on the wall near the hostess podium.  Pretty sweet.  Anyway, we went last Sat night and we were seated fairly quickly (with reservations).  We were celebrating a birthday and it appeared there were about 2 or 3 other birthday's going on that night as well so it was full of large groups.  Not a problem.  They were doing the restaurant week menu and everyone opted for that.  I had the "Steak and Potatoes" option.  Medium rare.   The steak came out nicely and they chilled a red wine for us that someone at our table had specifically asked for. Seasonings were good on the food and good char on the steak.  The dessert options were limited for Restaurant week, but the chocolate mousse was a nice finish.  The server was friendly and attentive.  Although there is one woman who is my favorite.  Cant remember her name.  She is on the top section.  The service was not too slow and they did not rush us either.  Even though we end up spending about two hours there.    I still really like Del Friscos even though it is overpriced, but I think Sullivans may have won me over.

aawxhtqqIbYkORbiKbcSag.text: Sadly, I have to say my last experience was not really that great.  We went for our anniversary back in October.  Our waiter was fantastic he deserves 4 stars, but the food was just ok, the wine list was very expensive, the environment was pleasant but it didn't have the feel of pride, hip and clean like it has in the past.  This was one of our favorite "special treat" places for years.  I'm sad that it wasn't great.  We may give it one more try just because it was so great before and everyone can have a bad night, but we're still on the fence on returning.

fxJwPUd9mV5GtCtvw8qM_w.text: Food was great, service wasn't bad. A little over priced for their servings but overall satisfied

32A2fKVCwfcdPPPQeBesJQ.text: It was ok... They messed up my steak temp and took forever to bring back the same one that had been reheated. Of course, this made for a much less tender steak. My suggestion, if you want the best steak, go to Del Frisco's. I think they are owned by the same Double Eagle group. Del Frisco's is the better and more upscale of the two.

_MwojiDwS_nxFDKsg5vslw.text: The best and most elegant of all the pricy steakhouses. Definitely worth a try for Restaurant Week.

33jgNQocTtzBWpcbYKvxoA.text: I've read a few of the reviews and I must say, any rating below 4 stars is insane.  My experience at this restaurant was nothing less than outstanding.  My wife brought me here as an early birthday celebration, and the atmosphere was very cool. They had a small talented band that provided background music which added to ambiance of the place.  The service was great from the time that we entered the door until we left. The waitress that we had was very nice, always communicated with us in regards to receiving our order, and she was incredibly helpful. Now as far as the food goes, simply amazing.  The Shrimp and lobster bisque is just sooooooo good along with the ahi tuna with the cucumber and ginger.  And ofcourse this being a steakhouse the steaks have to be on point. I had the New York strips and I must say that the steak juicy, tender, and full of flavor. My one and only complaint is the fact there was this group that was extremely loud but the fact the tables were close didn't really affect my dinning experience.  All and all, this is a great restaurant and I would recommend this to friends.

-50n7asCT1U9SMmPPbVP0g.text: We've been to Sullivan's 5 times.   The first time was fantastic and full price. The second time was Restaurant week. The 3rd, 4th, and 5th was for their Sunday Prime Time special for various occasions.  First thing I have to say is AVOID RESTAURANT WEEK.  They're way over crowded, the menu is limited, and you're going to wait.  Second thing... DEFINITELY hit their Sunday Prime Time Special.  For $32, you get twice the selection as restaurant week, and the food is prepared fresh.  Third... get the Bananas Foster Bread Pudding for dessert.  It's awesome.    Fourth... highly recommend Renee as a server.  She was attentive, friendly, helpful, and on top of things.    So in conclusion... 5 stars for Renee, the Sunday Prime Time Special & the bread pudding.  2 stars for restaurant week (and take any reviews written during restaurant week with a grain of salt).

vjk8lqyJzShU2NROEnKOcg.text: Went to sullivans a few months ago on a thursday with live band playing. Was fairly packed and a good vibe. Drinks specials for martinis were  very good. Was very impressed with the selection and pricing of thier bar bites-- i hope this is still available?! the steak from the bar menu was a generous portion as was the fish. Would definently go back for this.

atmBE4rEf9rse7IuqhCi8w.text: Great place to eat! I love that it is located right out of the city so I don't have to mess with parking uptown. My favorite thing to do is come on a Thursday night for $6 bar food and drinks and then take the lightrail to the Common Market in South End or all the way into town for shows and games.  You can also host private events here! They make it really easy to do. Highly recommended!

HRLbqMnAMF0G4fM_V1eJ3g.text: Came to Sullivan's for drinks before dinner at a restaurant close by. I started with the Knockout because I love Pineapple (basically vodka soaked with pineapple) and my husband got the old fashioned. Both delicious. 2nd round was a French75 and a Manhattan (my hubby commented that they served it in the proper glass). Good drinks and had food before (decent). Only negative comment was 2 employees having a "bitching" session in front of us - completely understand there are like 2 of us in here but maybe take it into the kitchen?

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. French 75

D_1gQiQ32g5yL55VqGQ7lg.text: We celebrated my wife's birthday tonight. The service was excellent as was the meal. All in all a positive experience.

XeskDHDXvbQI2irokLEU7g.text: My husband & I dined here for the first time on Valentines Day.  We had a 6:30 reservation and arrived a few minutes early.  We were asked to wait a few minutes so we sat on the sofa next to the hostess stand.  We glanced to our right and could see behind the hostess stand.... OMG.  One of the hostesses skirt was so short and I mean short...just barely covering her buttocks.  My husband turned away quickly & just shook his head.  This young lady also had on hot pink 6"-7" pumps.... if I didn't know we were in a steakhouse I would have thought we were in a strip club!  Not a good presentation for a fine dining restaurant.    We were seated quickly in a back room which was more intimate and quiet.  We thoroughly enjoyed the light jazz which was playing.  Our server was ok.  He mumbled quite a bit, so we struggled at times to understand what he saying but other than that he was ok.  We enjoyed the Valentines menu and thought it was more reasonably priced than some of the other steakhouses  we had looked at.  The food was very good.    Upon observing some of the female servers, they don't seem to have an established dress code or uniform other than wearing black.  Some had their boobs on display, skirts extra short, decorative tights, etc.  Management should really look into this because it is really a bad reflection on the restaurant.    Overall, the food was very good.  The atmosphere was lacking only due to the fact you didn't know what you would see next with the servers.

k-XHbPCXjx8vUc3kXQ9L4Q.text: Service was awful from beginning to end. Got the wrong cooked steak twice. It was salty. Au gratin potatoes came out cold and was just cubed potatoes. Mgr came out and said he will have my food redone and he will comp it. Never got my food because he thought he was just going to comp it only. So I guess he was ok with taking my charge off my bill and me not eating at all? But I get the bill and he still charges me for my meal even though I made sure that it will get taken off. I asked for creamed spinach as a substitute - the waiter comes back and said they weren't allowed to give me creamed spinach, so he CHOSE creamed corn FOR ME instead. What if I was allergic to corn? Why not come back and say that creamed spinach as a substitution wasn't allowed and what would I like instead? The only bright spot for this visit was Hugo who was on top of filling up our glasses and getting us fresh bread. Our waiter came to us every 15 mins or so. We'd ask Hugo for something and he'll be back within a minute or 2.

FGXbotDj1QoYpXXd4jNWGQ.text: Unbelievable.  Simply unbelievable.  My wife and I are visiting Charlotte, but other family members selected Sullivan's and we're glad they did.  We arrived about a half hour early, and the bartender Ryan mixed the best Gibson I've had in a long, long time.  After the rest of our party arrived, we were seated and our server Layla was fantastic.  She helped my brother and sister-in-law pick a nice red wine, and she helped us order and cared for us throughout the meal.  The food was EXCELLENT!  Truly EXCELLENT!  An amazing and thoroughly enjoyable evening was had by all--I don't know if we'll ever get back to Charlotte, but if we do, Sullivan's will MOST DEFINITELY be the one place we will go back to.

AhlaBI2eOfU-RAA5TusP5g.text: Had to give one star since there isn't an option for 0. From food to service this place is very unorganized - seems like they employed bunch of inexperienced staff from the outback or longhorn specially our host April.  I was with a large group (40 pax) for our company holiday dinner, where we have 4 of this type of events every year. Usually goto Del Frisco's and will continue. This place was a very bad choice.

YSHeuV_eu7t9XXXczsP30g.text: Went to Sullivan's last night for dinner and it was great!   When we pulled up, we were offered complimentary valet service. Once inside, we were taken straight to our table (we had a reservation for 7pm (Saturday), and there weren't too many people when we first arrived--the place was pretty full when we left). Once we sat down, we were given our menus and our water glasses were filled immediately. The waitress came over shortly after and gave us a drink menu.  **Our waitress, Melissa, was wonderful!**  We ordered the Shrimp Cocktail for an appetizer (so good!). We each had a steak (filet mignonette and cowboy ribeye) and decided to share sides -- we chose the cheddar bacon potatoes au gratin and the broccoli. Everything was soooooooo good! (Except the broccoli--but that's a personal preference! It was just slightly steamed and didn't seem to have much salt. It was definitely fresh, but not very tasty to us!) Make sure to try the Gorgonzola Garlic!! So good with the steak!  Because we were celebrating a birthday, the restaurant payed for his dessert! We had the Key Lime Pie.  **Our waitress, Melissa, was amazing! She was funny and helpful. She wasn't overbearing, but she never kept us waiting too long!**  Absolutely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cowboy Ribye - Oscar Style
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. White Cheddar and Bacon Au Gratin Potatoes
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Cocktail

Oau9BpKTJ6a0OGXMbGH3pA.text: Really used to love this place but the service has gone down hill. They over cooked 3 out of the 6 steaks, mixed up cocktails, dented someone's car, and forgot to bring silverware. I was actually embarrassed I had recommended this place for a work function. They had a million servers standing around bantering while tables had to ask for plates to be removed in between courses and silverware  to be provided... this is probably why the steaks were over cooked as wait staff was not paying attention! The front of the house did an excellent job at helping to organize a special surprise but the whole experience was ruined by the lack of attention by the wait staff who clearly did not want to be working!

81yd5e1vRvWsasYS7mLpYg.text: Very slow receiving our cocktails. Stayed empty several times. My husband got the $70 Wagyu suggested and told you could cut it with a fork. He also got it Oscar style and cooked med rear. This was extremely tough and had to cut even with the knife. My sisters steak was charred way to much, burnt on outside. Potato Au gratin wet undercooked and zero flavor and the lobster Mac and cheese, served told us you had, had zero lobster in it. It took approximately 30 min for server to return our bill and card after trying to pay and left us sitting with nothing on the table to drink, not even water. No manager ever visited our table! My Sea Bass was amazing, but that's not enough to bring us back! (I was looking to see if I got a response to my review and it had been deleted? So posting again, I had a picture of the Wagyu Oscar that we brought home thinking my son would eat it? Nope, to tough and gave to the dog)

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wagyu Oscar style, very tough, brought home because charged $80.

8jAEwAdrcyjnio9melg7ww.text: Just left there after 3.5 hours. We've been going here for over 15 years and have never left feeling very disappointed and frustrated. The food and service has left a sour taste. We ordered what now used to be our favorite Calamari and the dish contained very few pieces of it and the rest was jalapenos. My filet came out well done instead of medium rare. I had pre ordered my dessert, bit took over an hour for it to arrive. I had asked 2 separate servers to check but they never came back with any updates or acknowledgements.  Management was nice enough to discount our wine since the two we had ordered was out of stock. However, they failed to notify our server so of course it was not deducted from the bill so had to wait another 30 min for her to straighten it out with management. Needless to say, we will not be going back. Hope management makes some changes soon or they will lose more devoted customers.

rM_2ZfambCg1o6OsNFKbkw.text: I was very disappointed. I sat at the bar because I was on my way home from work and eating alone. I ordered a petite filet and a 16 oz lobster tail. They came out with a 6-7oz lobster tail. I questioned it and they offered me another 7oz. This may seem trivial but the taste and quality difference between a 7oz and a 16oz is profound. The 7oz tends to be overcooked while the 16 oz is perfectly moist and succulent. I sent back the 7oz and asked them to send me what I ordered. They returned with two undercooked 7ozs and stated "we took it off the bill but because of the time that it takes to cook the 16oz, therefore we cooked them both less so they wouldn't be tough" not knowing how to respond I stated "I wasn't in a rush". Check please. I'll never go back. Not one manager came to speak to me. They left the poor bartender to apologize on her own. It wasn't her fault so I made sure her tip reflected the lobster tail still on the check. I'll spend my money elsewhere is all. At an establishment like this- just give the patron what they want. They don't mind paying for what they want. I wasn't there for a free lobster tail, I wanted an exceptional meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1lb tail or two from red lobster...hmmm this is a tough one...no pun intended

8eXrjs8rYy3fidEmZrFhpw.text: PSA: do not order the Fresh Broccoli with Hollandaise Sauce. For $9.50, you will get an undercooked crown of broccoli with no hollandaise sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. PSA: do not order the Fresh Broccoli with Hollandaise Sauce. Pictured: undercooked crown of broccoli with no hollandaise sauce for $9.50.

ZIblx2-JTI_98DWkPRRrcQ.text: Our waitress April was fantastic. The food was stellar. Steaks were cooked perfectly and the Philly Egg Rolls were rich. The drinks were ok, a little light for my taste but overall a lovely dinner. The scallop potatoes and mushrooms were great with the steak.   My wife ordered the 8oz filet and I ordered a 12oz filet. When they came out, mine looked more like the 8oz Filet but I was already getting a little full I didn't complain. Our waitress noticed and sent me home with another 8oz which I threw on the grill the following night. That is what I call service.

_EGIyj82_cz2A-vRcq9K5g.text: Here is an update on my previous review from January.  Per the response from management on 2/2/19 here on Yelp, I clicked the link and filled out the details of the issue at their corporate site.  Now more than 6 weeks later, I have not heard not a word in response.  Based on the subsequent reviews here, most of which have been bad, it appears the pattern now is for service to be terrible, then management to leaves a cut-and-paste "We're sorry to hear about your experience" reply, directing guests to fill out yet another form, apparently as some kind of placebo, but then do nothing at all to remedy the situation or even make a cursory reply.  Talk is cheap.    Back when the company was owned by Del Frisco's, I had nothing but good experiences, but now that it's owned by the struggling Macroni Grill corporation (which declared Chapter 11 Bankruptcy in 2017 and abandoned the Ballantyne location around the same time), it's clearly circling the drain, one step behind its former neighbor The Liberty.

vuFf1OHTF2m3A2oAZkw-ZA.text: 4.5 stars. My daughter took us to Sullivan's Steakhouse. This was the second visit for me and my husband. The atmosphere is great, the food was delicious and the waitstaff attentive. We had an 8 oz. steak, potatoes, onion straws, wedge salad (daughter had Caesar salad) and dessert. My daughter had a 12 oz. steak. Complimentary bread is served before your appetizer arrives. Since we ordered our steaks well done I appreciated that our server asked us to cut into it to make sure it was done to our satisfaction. Mine was a little red on the inside so she took it back and returned a few minutes later with a perfectly done steak. It's the little things, you know?  They had a special, $39 per person, which is wonderful. But you have to ask for the special since it's not advertised. I think the price is reasonable for all you get, which was filling and delicious. I left there a happy camper. Definitely recommended.

Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

o-CMXig-VYPn3QaGp-SYhw.text: We had reservations here on a Friday night for a party of five. We pretty much went straight to the meat.  Our party had the wagyu bone-in, long-bone ribeye, bone-in strip, filet, and NY strip.  All were very good and only one was underdone.  Sides were delicious--scalloped potatoes, sauteed mushrooms, and broccoli (although the broccoli could have been cooked a little more for all our tastes).   Service was a little spotty...very good at times, a little lost at others. Any requests took a while before returning to the table.  We also wish that the plates were warmed because the steaks cooled down really fast.

n8iVHAynLe743smpCKWa4w.text: Delicious and cheap happy hour!  Truffle steak tartare and chorizo stuffed dates $7 each.  Don't know which we liked better as they were both excellent.  Signature cocktails also $7 and well made.  Would return here.

5D9PV7L4irz8M2tYr9ok_w.text: Delicious raw cheeseburger. Thanks for giving my family food poisoning. Are there no standards here?!

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

3p26zxiBloUA26Gq9S4-JA.text: Food and staff were absolutely wonderful. They were very attentive and friendly. Offered suggestions and wine pairing as well. I'll definitely be back.

V0oinjheLRWrqohW-Hb-TA.text: Our waitress mentioned that they are under new ownership and it showed. They definitely have stepped up their game for a 4 star steakhouse to a 5 star in my opinion. Try the spinach and Mac n cheese!

BlM-gF2FQEcXynsZYvDTcA.text: Unimpressed. Met a friend for drinks and ate from the bar menu. She said her burger was super salty and the homemade chips were stale. My tavern steak was a lot of gristle, although the sauce and sauteed spinach and mushrooms were good. The prices were good ($6 for each), but if you're using low quality or leftover ingredients, what's the point?

86N9AdxaiH9XyZ2W9FNoJQ.text: We went to Sullivans about a year ago on Mothers day.   The service was prompt and the food was great.  Sullivans has become my favorite steak restaurant in charlotte.    They have the best Fillet I have ever had in any steak house.  I have also heard people rave about their fried lobster.  I will definitly go back and I heard it is Restaurant week prices every Sunday.

VhaeBMKDbHd5nV--IkOpqg.text: We always go to Sullivan's for most of our special occasions! Love this place! Can't say enough about the food or service!

NeOupyMVEACrlssY0apgwg.text: Not a fan of chains but I had been wanting to go here for a while to try the steak.  The food is good but the service you get here is top notch. Great place to celebrate an event such as a birthday or promotion - just make sure someone else picks up the tab...wink wink.

M1ZfpbLHmucADZyn27qaPw.text: We went for the first time to celebrate our 2 birthdays.   From the friendly greeting to the amazing server (Austin) to the 2 managers who checked in on us (and brought us roses for our birthdays),  it was just a stellar experience from start to finish.  This was our first time here and I would recommend to anyone looking for top notch service and amazing food.  Lots to recommend from the knockout drink to the ribeye and filet to the creme brulee.  Thanks to Sullivan's for making this a special night!  We'll definitely be back.

ppyNHWLU38-rW1FZz9gi-g.text: In town for work and had the chance to catch it during restaurant week. Get the bay salmon and green beans. You won't be disappointed.  The mango sorbet was perfect, not fake mango flavored-had that real mango taste. Bar area was nice, bar hands are awesome. Had a few Moscow mules and enjoyed live entertainment on a Thursday night. Go, you won't regret it.

L41OZ55UhpG9hOcrhSQgrA.text: Went this past Friday during Queens Feast and it was amazing. My gorgeous date and I made reservations for 8.30 but had to push them back 15 mins. When we got there valet was prompt as we walked to the front desk they said the wait will be shortly. We grabbed cocktails at the bar, which they were excellent "pours", we then waited a little longer. The staff and the managers kept updating us on the wait. They finally had out table ready after 20 mins. They sat us down and the manger told our waiter "Bob"(who is awesome btw) to get us a appetizer on the house for waiting so long. The food was amazing, the service was excellent. I totally recommend Sullivan's as the perfect date night spot.

8OWtkNrFcGPjYBATIql4qg.text: YUM! I know this place is a chain, but it was so friggin good.  Luckily my boss took me here ( hello open credit card), and it couldn't have been a better experience.  We had the seafood platter and calamari to start.  Both were excellent.  Now lets get to the bulk, the steaks. I had a 12 oz filet which was a great cut of meat.  I asked for medium and they cooked it perfectly.  The perfect amount of pink on the inside. My other coworker got the 22oz cowboy cut which was just absurd.  His skinny butt somehow finished the whole thing.  Beyond this, the service was outstanding.   Pros: everything you could want  Cons: A bit pricey, but hey you get what you pay for. Plates are about $35-$55.

cNrTGnC_2h-VtPVAhx8wfw.text: First off I've been to Sullivan's a hundred times in Raleigh and a couple times at this location in Charlotte.  I don't know what it is but I guess I just pick the worst nights to come here.   The first time they told me it would be a 45 min wait and I waited 2 hours before I was seated just to find out they were basically out of everything on the menu.  I actually banned coming back until I was invited here for a Christmas dinner this year.  I know this is a very busy time a year in the restaurant business but when you pay this much for food - I expect   1.)  Appetizers to not take 45 min to come out & be cold 2.) Waiter to not throw away our leftovers after we have asked for a box 3.) When the man at the table already seems annoyed by your service and then you persist on throwing the dessert menu in his face (let's just say not a good move on your part) *he is paying the bill  It sucks because I really like Sullivans steak and in Raleigh I have always been happy with my food and service.

NVkRhh6znoiOqc_v1H0f3w.text: Very good overall.  We had the filet and the chicken.  Lobster bisque and kale/pecan salad are recommended.

bqL6_E5pSQHngglR_qBTxw.text: I took three family members to Sullivans for a celebratory meal on friday evening. The dining room was so loud that we could not converse.The salad was tastless and the steak highly salted. But the biggest disappointment was no jazz music as advertised. I even phoned four hours  prior to verify the music.This was important to me as one of my guest's is a jazz muscian of some reputation.I will mot return to Sullivan's and now will be going to Captial Grill as before.

2xQe6YODgVYHyIza2rKxzQ.text: I couldn't recommend Sullivan's more highly.   The food is exceptional, but at around $100/person that's expected. What wasn't expected was the service. I've never been treated so well at any restaurant. Our server Ashley was phenomenal.   I'm a bonafide cheapskate, and after spending $200 on a meal walked away feeling like it was a bargain.

0igNkHMKZBBNrZvBPgGhsQ.text: We went during restaurant week. It annoys me when restaurants use that as an excuse, but I think it's a fair disclosure in a review.  Food was worth at least 4.5 stars -- maybe 5. Our waitress was wonderful; she provided practical advice regarding food selections, even as we tried to figure out how to navigate the menu given the option of the restaurant week prix-fixe choices. We each had the kale salad, which had wonderful ingredients, though the creamy dressing took away from the natural tastes of the kale, pecans, and dried berries. I had a 12-ounce filet, which was quite well-prepared. I like steak cooked medium-well, which earns glares from foodies and so I often get a lower-quality barrel-cut filets (as I did on this night), but it was cooked perfectly and I didn't notice the extra fat or toughness that this cut sometimes has. My wife had the 6 oz filet from the prix-fixe menu. Horseradish mashed potatoes on her plate had a "seafood restaurant" kind of flavor, but she ate some of my baked potato, which was enormous and yet perfectly cooked, which is often hard with the largest potatoes.  Two stars because the front-of-house management was not good and left a bad taste in our mouths for the night overall. Valet service was required, though there was ample parking right in front of the restaurant (that had been blocked off for the valet service). That wouldn't have been awful (it is free) except that when we exited, there were seven or eight cars backed up waiting to be parked and one harried valet attendant running to and fro. He paid no attention to us or the four other groups waiting for their cars, so I went over and told him to give me my key and tell me where my car was. That worked out nicely, actually, because my car was pretty close. If you're not going to let me park my car, though, you'd better have the valet process down cold.  The hostess and seating attendant were young girls who seemed to think it was their job to protect the restaurant from people they deemed insufficiently cool. I didn't feel welcomed, and they were not prepared to seat us at our reservation time (they didn't apologize, but said, "you can wait in that corner" and pointed to the three square foot area next to the walkway to the bar. When the seating attendant took us to our table, she started clanking around the extra glasses and silverware (the table had been set for 4 rather than 2), though she left them all cluttered up there anyway, and didn't give us enough menus.   The restaurant is too crowded -- tables are squeezed together to maximize revenue, I suppose -- and was quite loud: so much so that my wife and I had trouble understanding each other across a corner booth table (we're in our thirties -- not hard of hearing or anything).  Quite good food, but Sullivan's is a "special event" kind of restaurant, and there are places in town that create a special night out kind of experience, so I wouldn't go back to Sullivan's.

8LdL08oCmgJ6DmzTFXE2_Q.text: Food was terribly salty, salads were inedible, poor service, average appetizers, disappointing wine by the glass selection, the steak was good, aside from the salt in the sauce, and it was cooked well. All in all, they are very proud of a mediocre experience. For the money, I will not return.

3LQww-UbUCa_Hpvd0pbu3Q.text: Not s fan!!!!   Steak was covered in pepper and just wasn't very good considering the $42 price tag!   Sides are extra as well. Not impressed think I'll stick with beef and bottle!

gzZaIa1dnHscSRyWp8Fc0g.text: Great food! Great service! Great atmosphere! Three things I look for when I am heading out for dinner. April is the waitress to ask for. She works in the bar area and will make sure you dining experience is second to none.

4qu4Pr2LHFBQzMT_9aSkwg.text: Went for a work event and was impressed witht he level of service and quality of food. I know with a large group (over 20) it can be hard on the server/kitchen but not here. All the food was fresh, delishious and came out at perfect temps. I had the roasted chicken which was very tender/moist and well seasoned with the mashed potatoes, equally as good and green beans. I would go back and eat again on my own based on this experience with the large group.

s7Uf6JFArfithrIOzpKG3A.text: We loved the live music. Good customer service. A great dinner deal for two. Most of all, we were  really content with the food. We hope to visit again in the near future.

Y_7agc15zwiLTwPk7jAGpg.text: We took my step daughter there for her 13th birthday as we wanted to take her somewhere nice and she wanted steak but we didn't want to drop a "Del Friscos" amount of money...the over all ambiance was nothing great , way too brightly lit for an evening dinner and the fact you have no choice but to valet park and They park your car right outside the door is a little much but I understand uptown parking can be an issue so no big deal there . Our server was nice, my finance's steak was more rare than medium so we did have to send that back and when I ordered my 2nd glass of wine the server came over and poured what was left of my old glass Into my fresh glass, which is a huge etiquette "no,no" especially at $15 a glass...  It was a nice treat and we like to try someone new every time we go out but I doubt we will going there again.

isipIPGiWBt8CCexkPa4sQ.text: I eat here often and they have never disappointed.  Being from NYC, I'm a big fan of fine steak restaurants and Sullivan's has everything I want when good beef is called for.  The service is always great and they make me feel like a local.

MzML714oTVNRy3C0-zxHmw.text: You know... frequenting Southend for years and years you tend to forget about the old stalwarts. Stopped in Sullivan's tonight for a couple cocktails and apps and they crushed it. Like they always do.   Need to make this a regular rotation.   Beef tartare. Poke sliders. Stuffed dates. Pineapple martinis. Perfect little date night (no pun intended).   We will be back. Sooner than later this time.
