s40u4gCTN27ONHogv-49xA.text: We had terrible food and service during Restaurant Week. I ordered the bone in filet ($20 up charge and was supposed to be 14 oz.) and it was raw. I requested it be cooked for medium rare. After 20 minutes I knew it would be over cooked and sure enough it was well done. So I asked them to redo it and box it up since my table had finished their meal. I had to have a few bites of my daughter's meal so I didn't starve. All they offered me was a drink but I don't drink alcohol. Worst experience ever at a restaurant. Our waitress also had a really bad attitude which didn't make the night out any better. We will never go back. There are much better restaurants that have good food and service.  When I got home I cut the meat off the bone and the meat only weighed 5.5oz. Totally not worth the $20 upgrade. There is no way the bone weighed over 8oz. Total rip-off.   -1 Star

JKvbUAoVC47y0w9QJzCJqg.text: We were a party of 4 adults. 2 of us were served the wrong steaks. So other couple sent food back to wait for our re-cook. Food was good thankfully. Disappointing a manager did not even come by. Billing was all wrong too with drinks crossed and not on the right bill.  Glad I left some crumbs for the insect that buzzed around during our meal.  I will pass on this place next time.  Was not worth the 30 min drive or aggravation.

o1hW4mbbkBuie3o_FHVmOA.text: Not impressed.  This is my first review ever. I'm writing this at the dinner table. First time in Charlotte and I wanted to try different Steak Houses I have never been to. We went to Bonterra Restaurant and Wine Room on Wednesday night and the food was exceptional . We decided to try Sullivan's Steak House today and it doesn't even come close. First of all, I had to switch tables due to constantly having to swat a gnat away from my food. We ordered The Sure Thing which gives us a three course meal. I have honestly had better Caesar salad at Red Lobster. We both decided on the 12oz New York Strip Steak upgraded Sure Thing option. It came with their bourbon peppercorn sauce. The sauce is the only thing that saves this steak from being horrible. I have been to plenty of places that make you don't even want to dip your steak in any sauce. This steak was very chewy and not seasoned. The White Cheddar & Bacon AU GRATIN POTATOES weren't any better. Not seasoned at all. To make matters worse we were celebrating a special occasion. I seriously regret coming here. Never again.  Update. I responded to this businesses reply to go to their page and leave my review. I still haven't heard back from them as of yet. 07/25/2019

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Unhappy tip

SNXUZdF-lmMLVPkaOmgMhA.text: Listen!!!!! If you come here and don't get served by Emily Piipen you are not experiencing the BEST...Trust me out of the top 5 waiters in my life she is # 1 second to none. Meeka and Carlton was on the grill line THEY KNOW SOMETHING....If this not making sense to you just ask for Emily Piipen and the rest is history. Leave Big Tips for Em as well. Peace and Blessings

AWLRgXahRJTxdFhIZ-kIwQ.text: This use to be my favorite restaurant in the Charlotte area. We've recently relocated back from TX and came here for our Anniversary dinner. I ordered my favorite: Chilean Sea Bass. The sea bass was cooked well, but the glaze was burnt. I ate the fish, but didn't want any glaze on it. Our girls both ordered the Scallops. They were cooked well, but lacked seasoning. To start it all off (going a bit backwards) it annoys us to no end when there is NO ONE in the restaurant and the greeter asks us if we have a reservation. I think 2 tables were occupied, but that was it. No need to ask if we have a reservation. Please go back to how good you were 11 years ago when you did need a reservation to get in. Lost a lot of your luster.

8Az5hVbXYlVYzHvrGGwHFw.text: I was a first time guest and received extremely poor service. Everything was bad from start to finish. Waited 15 minutes to get greeted. Forgot to put our appetizer order in and didn't get it until after the meal came. Steak came over cooked. Waited 15 minutes on a beer and server said she thought someone else ran it for her. No pre-bussing, we had dirty dishes on the table the whole meal. felt like I was at a sports bar. Very disappointed.   The only good part of the meal was the man that sat us and got our drinks and the guy manager with twists.

p3sJx0Cxck8bfs1gQj3CLw.text: We were stranded in Charlotte due to a storm so found this restaurant on Yelp and we had mixed feelings about our experience. The Bone in Ribeye was not the best I have had, but was fine. The side dish of Sprouts were so bad and chewy, I even told our server to let the chef know they are real bad. She just smiled and didn't even care. I attempted to eat other sprouts on the dish and all were badly cooked. The oyster appetizer was very good.

4Y8xT1ira8xSRf8zppQN3g.text: I made a reservation here for Christmas as most places were closed, however Sullivan's was up and running at noon! I arrived earlier than my reservation and they had no issue seating us. I requested booth through the reservation app and they were attentive enough to provide one.   The servers and staff were all friendly and professional, their attires seem a bit tacky and tight, but hey the service was good.   FYI, you don't need to valet as there's plenty of parking on the lot.  On to the food! It's a steakhouse so expect to see all types of cuts and also expect to see some expensive prices too!   The quality is top notch and the portions are generous. My 26oz Ribeye was excellent as was my baked potato. The Rack of Lamb was also amazing as was the 3 cheese Mac.   We reserved room for dessert and had the Hazelnut Creme Brulee which was delicious! HOWEVER, their Key Lime Pie was HORRIBLE! It was definitely OLD and NOT fresh!   Overall I would return and would recommend for special occasions.

vR9zL3oDf-xG5cvOq-ls0Q.text: Service reigns supreme to me.  Then, flavor is a close part B.   Today's call in then pick up was anything BUT flawless. I canceled Del Frisco's reservations so I could just pick up Sullivan's on the way home. Didn't feel like driving to South Park.   Anywhooz, today I learned Sullivan's is part of Del Frisco's corporate umbrella. Cool. I've had prior visits and didn't collect points but I will today.   Ordered the Sure Thing which is their 3 course price fixe. Arrived to no parking. Valet said just take handicap. So I feel uncomfortable and rushed.  I don't want to inconvenience any handicap placard or disabled person. I know the struggles.   Enter: no hostess.  I walk to bar. They redirect me to hostess stand.  I wait. She's sweet.  Gets ticket and it's double the cost. Someone didn't catch I asked for the "Sure Thing."   This took several attempts to fix including a manager saying it doesn't exist. Another Manger says it does and boom... the head Mgr fixes everything then exceeded my expectations with a bonus card for an official apology.   I was standing in the restaurant writing this 3 star review when it jumped to 5 because of how everyone took some extra initiative to WOW! the customer.   I didn't get the steak I ordered yet valet and mgmt were on par.  Why 3?  * I called back to inform someone that they didn't check us in for OpenTable. *I was told it was handled. I'm sure it was just some server passing by and answered the phone.  *minutes later I get the no show email from Open Table.  * There's room for improvement and I'm sure they'll make it. This won't deter me. Just taught me to dine in, always.

QsrMFZPE42Esk3_1T7ft5A.text: let me start by saying that going into restaurant week I usually expect about 50% of the service and the food that I normally get a throughout the year. But this experience was just terrible from top to bottom. Jared our server laked any sense of serving skills. And the manager came over because our food was about an hour late. And made some lame excuse about the fact he couldn't discount restaurant week food.The other food was very good once we got it. The lack of attention and the disrespectfulness from the management staff was disgraceful.I have been to Sullivan's many times and I had the most exceptional experiences but this one failed in every sense of the word. I will contact their corporate office.

PbeWAecWA3-sw2oK654T2A.text: We came for restaurant week dinner. Our reservation was for 5 PM, we came 10 minutes early . They asked us to wait the 10 minutes till 5 PM although plenty of seating available at this time. At 5 PM we were seated. The staff friendly and able to answer our questions about the menu. My dining mate and I ordered the shrimp lobster soup. He enjoyed it but my soup tasted very salty and  had some spice in it which  burned the back of my throat. The waitress promptly gave me a wedge salad instead to replace the soup as salad was one of the choices on restaurant week menu. The salad was basic and tasty, I've had better. Wished there could have been some bacon on it. While  we were eating our soup and salad, the main courses came to our small table. The small table for 2,   now crowded. I felt rushed and would have preferred to finish my salad but put it aside to start my steak. This entree was served with green beans and mashed potatoes but for 7 $ more I ordered the sauteed mushrooms instead of the potatoes. My  NY strip was cooked to order, the bearnaise sauce tasty. The  unseasoned green beans practically raw, I didn't eat them.  My dining mates filet was tasty and cooked to order with a tasty bordelaise sauce , likewise  with crunchy undercooked green beans. Interestingly his filet had 3 deep score marks when brought to the table, we wondered if the chef was checking for cooked status. We never had a filet presented that way. The sides of mushrooms delicious. Food  came out hot and plated nicely. My dining mate enjoyed his banana foster bread pudding. I  had my skimpy piece of NY cheesecake to go. So this was a mixed experience for us. Normally the regular menu pricy. Restaurant week gives one an idea about the restaurant and the food. I rated a 4  only for good  tasty tender steaks,  not a 5 because of  our mixed experience above.  I've been to other upscale  steak house restaurants before. Not sure I'd return again.

zfi6oJNf7eiADT8zUZecjw.text: Myself, along with my wife, aunt, cousin, stepdad and mom went here to celebrate my moms 60th birthday. This was her favorite place and where she wanted to go.   All of us had a range of experiences and overall, even with inconsistencies, we were very well taken care of. The manager made sure that anything that was wrong was corrected. My stepdad's steak was almost raw and he asked for medium. My moms asparagus was cold. My aunts hamburger had way too much pepper.   That said, my meal was cooked perfectly and it was very good. My wife and cousins meals were also perfect. I had the King crab legs and an order of Mac n cheese. Both were delicious. If the orders were consistent, which I would expect for this type of restaurant, it would easily be a 5 star. The only reason I'm giving 4 is due to the manager stepping in and making it all right.

5U4AzHKVPaYD_0IVuYOp9w.text: This place should close.  We came in tonight with a reservation at 7PM.  The reservation was unnecessary, we were there with only two other tables. One with a couple and one with a table of eight. I had received an email about prime rib Sundays here. When we arrived early in the evening the server said there was a miscommunication about the prime rib and had the manager come to explain. The explanation was that they only planned for eight people to order prime rib this evening. He was not very apologetic at all and what a poor excuse. He basically said no prime rib tonight and if we wanted to stay for something else well....but, he assured us there would be plenty of prime rib next Sunday. Well we stayed and had shrimp cocktails a couple of drinks and some okay steaks, but when you have a taste for prime rib well, you know there was no prime rib. We will not be returning next Sunday or anytime soon until they clean up their act.  There were three portable air conditioning units run in the dining areas and their sanitation score is in the danger zone at 90.5.               Well it's been two weeks now since I responded to the corporate website per their request and no follow up as stated.

44fE9GPr-zqZdt3aEfsxIw.text: Came here for restaurant week and had the dinner of a lifetime. The cocktail selection was unbelievable. Our server Jarrett, a young mustached man from Hickory, was the definition of southern charm. We could literally feel the passion he had for aged whiskeys when he walked us through the beverage menu. If you order your steak anything above medium rare here, you are doing yourself a major disservice. Their medium rare NY strip will drastically increase your standards for daily living. Sullivan's is also known for its extraordinarily sensual ambiance for date night! I'd recommend this place to anyone, and make sure to ask for Jarrett!

xGuoE8X1Spm1CwwMjSatyA.text: We'd been wanting to try Sullivan's for a long time, and finally gave them a try during Restaurant Week.  Sadly, we don't plan to return.  We were immediately put off by the fact that we had to wait until our reservation time to be seated.  Their entry is a small space with only a couple of seats, and it was both awkward and uncomfortable to have everyone waiting until 6pm.  When they took us to our table, the dining room was mostly empty, making me wonder why they made everyone wait at this early hour.   Things got better once we were seated in the dining room.  The room is spacious and nicely appointed, with lovely big band music playing quietly in the background.  Our server was very attentive.  But sadly, the food was a disappointment.  Our starters--lobster bisque and wedge salad--were fine.  But our entrees let us down.  I don't usually eat meat, but their seafood option during Restaurant Week was just salmon.  What?!  I can get salmon anywhere, and expected something better, like halibut or grouper.  So I got the 8 oz. filet, served Oscar style (with bearnaise sauce, asparagus, and lump crabmeat, for an $11 upcharge).  My husband got the 12 oz. New York Strip with bourbon peppercorn sauce.  There was very little crab on my steak, and it wasn't worth the extra charge.  My steak was also cooked medium-rare, when I had requested medium.  I would have expected a steakhouse to be able to cook a steak properly.  The server asked how we were enjoying our meals, and I showed her how underdone my steak was near the center, and she offered to have them place it back in the grill.  Everyone knows that recooking a steak practically ruins it, so I said no thanks, and gave the remainder to my husband.  His was cooked medium-rare, as requested.   Both entrees were served with their horseradish mashed potatoes and green beans.  The beans lacked flavor, and the potatoes were no better.  I rarely eat mashed potatoes, but I expected them to be better prepared at Sullivan's.  They tasted thin and almost watery, with no detectable cream or butter.    Our desserts were good - ice cream for my husband, and bread pudding (topped with ice cream) for me.    I'm not a fan of giving my keys to anyone, and was glad we could self-park in the Steelyard parking garage.  It's a pretty small garage, however, and was almost full when we got there shortly before 6.  (It is used for both Luciano and Sullivan's.)  My husband did say their steak tasted better than what he usually has, but the accompaniments were subpar.  If you are spending this much for dinner, everything should be fantastic.  We won't return.

dgAM9YQkTEYTRBIfK2xUtA.text: I have been wanting to go to Sullivan's for some time and I finally got to go for restaurant week this week. I would go even if it wasn't, but it is a really good deal to get a three course meal for $35 . First I must say the ambiance was very nice there and it set the mood for a nice romantic dinner.   I highly suggest this place for a nice date, special occasion , or if you want a really good dinner. The service was the best part about this place. I felt as if the staff was going to get it wrong when we first came through the door because it was a bit chaotic.  Nevertheless, to my surprise they were on top of it.   We were asked how everything turned out and honestly I ordered a medium rare NY strip steak and got a medium steak. They mixed up our orders. I was beyond hungry at that time to wait for another steak so I ate it . It was delicious but hard not to compare to the quality of other steakhouses in the area. She got the filet mignon and that tasted better than my NY strip . Not to exclude the fact that she got the medium rare too.    Other than the mix up the place was great! The service, atmosphere, and food are all top notch.   I wish I could give this place five stars, like other restaurants on AP's famous must eat restaurants if you are in Charlotte (2018 version coming soon), but not just yet. Stay tuned!

3vqmQoFeIFxFGL8CVremVA.text: Quality of restaurant has really declined in the recent year. This use to be our favorite restaurant but more recently the service and overall performance has been lacking to say the least. On Valentines Day my fiance and I booked a reservation for 8pm. We were promptly seated (not normal there is normally an additional 15-20 minute wait), upon sitting down we were given a scaled down menu that was apparently for that day. This was a surprise considering when booking we asked would there be any changes like they do for Restaurant Week etc. The hostess confirmed it would be a normal day.  It was in fact not normal at all, most and I truly mean most of the seafood selections were gone. We tried to stick it out, places the order and enjoyed the ambiance. A few moments late the waitress came back to let us know they were out of 2 of the maybe 6 side items they had that day. At this point we left and agreed to come back on a less busier day. We choose Sunday 2/17 for a redo. Upon sitting down we could tell the service was off but had high hopes for the food. The appetizers were great, my fiance order from the sure thing menu so he choose a salad and desert, once the server saw I wasn't getting either he offered to provide cheesecake "on the house" I declined. He then offered salad or bisque seemingly from the goodness of his heart. When we got the check we saw that we were not only charged for it but charged incorrectly. We are not the type to dispute each item on the bill so we paid and had the leftovers (almost the full entree because we had so many other things). Once we got home we noticed it seemed like we were missing items, however they weren't missing everything was just boxed together.. like literally potatoes spinach steak salmon shrimp all in one box smh. At this caliber of restaurant I just expect more. Super disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Leftovers thrown in box like trash

bK5xnqGiVkVbuj5fF7t0Ig.text: Took the wife here for her Birthday Dinner and as predicted it was NOT a disappointment. Unfortunately, I gave up Land Meat for Lent so I could not partake in the deliciousness that is Steak and/or Lamb. I did however eat the next best thing, the "Steak of the Sea" if you will... Salmon. Oh, and a 1/2 lb Lobster Tail, so... you can feel my pain. Everything was upper class from the staff's handling themselves to the amazing lighting. As an electrician I notice those thing, but anywho, the dinning room was pristine with white linen table cloths to the spotless dishware. We started with the crab cake, not cakes but cake this is A la cart people don't look to leave without dropping $100.00 for 2 easy and that's with water. As I have said before dinning is an experience and not a necessity, you want an experience then you may need to spend a bit. That will last you a life time and give you a great story to tell. Anyway, I tasted no breading just Massive pieces of crab and the mini salad on top... Spot on. My wife went for the fillet mignon and she went Med/Rare and it came out Med/Rare almost fork tender good. So basic, so simple but most amazing things are. Next, and this should be your whole reason for getting up everyday at 5,6,7am and drudging yourself to an office, construction site, a retail store whatever it is that makes you the fund to enjoy life worth living for... DESSERT! They have your basic Cheesecake, Key lime Pie, I think a Bananas Forster Bread Pudding but, and you may want to sit for this one, Nutella Creme Brulee. Discuss amongst yourselves for a bit. Yes, a delicate balance of custard, melted sugar and what I'm guessing are the tears of Chuck Norris will bring you to your knees. It is... Punch a Baby Good, knock it out for all I care that thing is insane not to mention massive. It's not inexpensive but neither is the experience. Eat, Drink, Tell

oJA4YpzdM72aGf-sDAyk7A.text: Wrote a review about my terrible experience at Sullivan's in South End Charlotte. The company responded to my review and asked to fill out a contact for to remedy the situation and did not respond or anything. DONT BUY INTO THEIR RESPONSES LIKE THEY CARE. TERRIBLE! Another example why not to eat here again

z8JpOYhQqYqBtITnznRi6g.text: I would probably give Sullivan's a better rating if they weren't pulling a bait-and-switch for Restaurant Week. The hostess "forgot" to give us (and all the tables around us) the Restaurant Week menu and the waiter tried to get us to switch to their Summer menu - which is of course more expensive (and I don't mean he just suggested it, it was a hard sell). I seriously don't appreciate that - we were only trying the place BECAUSE it was Restaurant Week! Come on!  I did enjoy the food - once we got them to hand over the special menu. I was hoping their meat would be Del Frisco's quality since they are owned by them, but not quite. Would I go again? Maybe. The bar was cool and they had a good bar menu.   Please make sure you specifically ask for the Restaurant Week menu so you get the deal you came for! I really hope this isn't a new trend for restaurants during Restaurant Week, it's so tacky!

uwI63Mx5_FUcOMPFgJd4Zg.text: Sullivans has won me back. We went for Christmas Eve.  The only problem was the reservation wasn't in the system but they got us in.  We got the Seafood Tower.  I had looked forward to the tower all week. I wasn't disappointed.  Crab, lobster tails, Shrimp Cocktails, and oyster were all fresh and delicious.  We had an excellent bottle of Viognier .  We all ate bacon wrapped scallops.  Yes, we ate seafood at a steak resturant because the get in fresh seafood several times a week.  We had the best service that we have ever had at Sullivan's.  I wish I could remember his name but he was originally from Ecuador.  He was attentive and gracious but not in our face.  It was a fabulous celebration for Christmas Eve.

LQ79GLadGMy1zTkjK4bDlw.text: The food at Sullivan's is amazing and probably the only reason I have this place two stars instead of one. My family decided to have thanksgiving dinner here along with two family friends. We had a dinner reservation at 6:15. We arrived promptly at 6:10 and used to complimentary valet to park the car. We waited about 30 minutes to be sat. Once sat we waited another long while for a server to come by and take our drink order. Dakota, our server, brought our drinks back and then disappeared for a while until coming back to take our order. We ordered two of the thanksgiving specials which comes with salad, two sides, turkey and dessert; we also ordered the one pound lobster tail, two crab cake appetizers and the Rockefeller salmon. The salads came out and we still had not received any bread or the appetizers. I had to ask the server if the crab cake was still coming or not. The crab cake arrived shortly there after. After finishing our salads and appetizer we still had no bread. We had to ask another server for bread to the table. Our entrees arrived soon after we got bread and were amazing. Everything was delicious absolutely no complaints of the food. However during the entrees, Dakota never came with refills and never stopped to check on everything. We then move onto boxing some entrees and getting the dessert, we waited about 15 minutes with no waiter and by the time we got to place the dessert order they had run out of the dessert we wanted. I got up to speak with a manager about the poor service and how it was unacceptable and he told me he would touch our table and speak with us directly. So we took the desserts Togo and waited for the checks. We had told Dakota at the beginning of the night we had two checks and how to split everything. The manager has still not stopped by and we are handed one check. So I asked a separate mama her from before to split the check and reiterated how bad the service was. This manager also assured me he would stop by and he would also adjust the check. Another 10 or so minutes goes by before we receive or checks. The adjustment was he took of the appetizers. After paying the bill a manager had still not stopped by. So we asked another server to bring a manager over. Once the manager got to the table all he had to say for the experience was that he agreed. He understood. It's safe to say we will not be coming back to this restaurant.

QFJrn7xaV7xuoRp--I1sMg.text: Jan 1 2017 after dinner at another near by steakhouse my girlfriend and I decided to check out the bar at Sullivan's before headed home . I was desperately dying for this dessert that another sister restaurant had but was closed so to my surprise Sullivan's had a better version !!!  Yay me ! I love the bar there !  It's so beautiful and it's always interesting conversations going on ( I like to ease drop ) . The bartender is Amazing  !!!!!!!' I prob couldn't have asked for a better bartender! Hell , I would write a review just off her . Now , I can't tell you her name ; not that I don't want to . I can't remember  ( something French sounding :John pi' Dom  )  She made me s few of these drinks she called nuts and berries and I was sold!  Everything was amazing! Please try the Banana Foster Bread Pudding.  Your mouth will thank you later!  But, this is a good example of how you can take a good bar and make it an outstanding bar just by having the right people behind it .

tXn-ZDriNE0OstiX1PuVXw.text: I haven't been there in a while  but this place was my fave. I wish they open one in all corners of Charlotte. It's a steak house with a few feathered in fine choices of seafood,  love the oyster and .y fave of all ahi tuna sashimi grade. Yummy

RB6kNtEWPplqhpB1CL5H9w.text: We went there for our anniversary a few weeks ago. The service is prompt but he didn't know what kind of steak they were serving us, had to ask the chef. He came back with a general response, it's prime meat...uh..okay!!! The food was decent but it wasn't the fancy experience we were hoping for. Overall, an okay experience.

Tz2AJLQNz_fSGjvbtbeKgA.text: I brought the ladies of the office here for lunch on International Women's Day this year. The staff was really great and accommodating. They let us do the sure thing pre fixe menu even though it was lunch time and not dinner. All of the food came out really well and very tasty including dessert. Everyone was really pleased with how things went and no one had any complaints about their food. I wouldn't say this is the best steakhouse I've every been to but honestly it is really good, their drink options are great, and the staff is amazing. You really can't go wrong by coming here.

6fkL39dToXtpcGL7w7n-sw.text: Excellent service !!  Live music outside on the patio.   Loved the kale salad !   I had the salmon,,  so good.    It has been remodeled since I was there before  great bar area ,,  they have small rooms for meetings.     Great sides creamed spinach,  mac and cheese and creamed corn is fantastic

wTw3rCvyK-BSs4UAMctjmA.text: Went for dinner last night, first time since the remodel. The bar area seemed nicer but I have to admit I preferred the charm the restaurant had before. My wife had the Filet it was tasty. I had Lobster tails they were also yummy. 1 thing I found weird was the clarified butter was real thick (not typical) I did not care for it. Our server was sort of an odd older gentleman. He did do his best, but sort or Over pushed a bottle of wine...it was pretty funny. All in all the visit was fine but not sure it was worth the money with so many other choices.

DrURiIcHazve3kMW68Aq_Q.text: Short and not so sweet on this one. When I am picking up a check for 10 people in a location that charges a rather high amount you expect great food, great service, and a great atmosphere.  Great atmosphere? 3 stars due to the lack of lighting Great Service? 5 Stars, very professional and accomidating, and very very apologetic.  Great Food? Negative 10. When I am in a dark setting (meaning low light) and I am served a "RAW" blood reddish pink piece of Pork then nothing else matters. When cooking with pork or thick chops one should be using a meat thermometer and serving at 170 degrees center point not room temperature. With this said, the staff and management did everything they could to make it right. A fluke, maybe but one that the manager will need to address with his kitchen staff.

-ZvEYWffIeSqqd7Hbgsesw.text: Always our old standby for date night. Service is always the best. We have gone to Sullivan's for every anniversary for the past 10 years plus birthdays. Glad to have a fabulous restaurant in the neighood.

eXCdVyfjHaKwJgaDk6sySQ.text: Great service and good food. Loved the cheesesteak egg rolls, iceberg salad and ribeye! We tried all sides and they were equally yummy. Especially the mushrooms ! Our table setup was angled oddly, but we made it work.

GFHuqSeec8QtZfboDxn6cw.text: It had been a few years since I had eaten at Sullivan's, but I recalled enjoying a great meal there for my former employer's Christmas party back in 2008.  With a $50 gift card in hand, we decided to head to Sullivan's to celebrate my husband's 30th birthday.  With expectations relatively high, I have to be honest and say that we were underwhelmed (and our pockets where overwhelmed, as the high prices did not reflect the quality of our experience).  We both ordered steak, which comes with a salad. We both opted for Caesar.  It was a very large portion, but lacking in flavor.  My filet was cooked properly, and the bourbon peppercorn sauce added a nice kick.  The porterhouse did not get such gleaming reviews.    The brussels sprouts were undercooked, but I have to say that the bacon pieces were delicious. The mushrooms were good, but I agree with another reviewer who said they were quite salty. And I am that person putting salt on everything, so that says something. We ordered a half bottle of Cote du Rhone, which was probably the highlight of the meal.  We opted out of dessert.  The service started out strong, but started to dwindle by the end. I just expect more of a high-end experience when you are dishing out $200 for dinner with no appetizer and no dessert.

DCLyUkZH-2NFewHBtu9t4w.text: Came here the other night on an extension of my best friend and I's indulgent outings.  We stopped in here after Nan and Byrons for martinis and an appetizer.  Completely blown away by the dirty martinis we had as well as the steak flatbread and bleu cheese wedge we shared. Everything was amazing! Its been a few days and I cannot stop thinking about that wedge salad. Great now I have to call her and go and do this all over again..... Yes this has to happen now........ The food was outstanding and I can only imagine what their steaks and entrees are like. I will have to also return with my guy soon so he can try.... and all my other friends until I run out of friends and I have to find new excuses to come as often as I want. We came on a Thursday and it was unexpectedly relaxed which main be the norm but it was my first time and for some reason I thought it was going to be a bit more fancy and stuffy but alas they had a live band and a good crowd and everyone seemed to be having a great time! The service was outstanding we sat at the bar as always.  I love the fact that they have a bar bites menu for a sort of happy hour. Definitely recommend this place for any occasion and I cannot wait to go (like in the next hour for sure since now I cant stop thinking about it)

M0wCvKHcQx-h-WgD7LH_5g.text: This steakhouse is fantastic. They're extremely accommodating. The staff is outstanding. G, Faith and Juda the bartenders are some of the best I've ever met. Travis the manager is extremely friendly and treats all of the guests here excellent. The food is phenomenal. Highly recommend going in on any night, sitting at the bar and having dinner and drinks.

zeswPoGTqYSrPEfOfDfeWQ.text: At first I was excited to see a local volunteer group scheduled our social for this location.  I left hungry and annoyed.  The good: nice bar area, they had a great duo or trio playing a stand up bass and nice music.   The bad: we ordered from the bar menu, which had good prices and seemed like a good idea.  It was not.  I ordered the "best burger in Charlotte" which turned out to be a seriously salty, dry, hard burger.  I ate a few bites thinking it might get better.  It didn't.  The home-made chips were not salty at all, cold, and tasted like they were cooked in old oil.  Not pleasant.  My friend ordered a "steak" dish which looked completely unappetizing and she said was just about all gristle.    I won't go back and would not recommend this restaurant.

oqXAnrenSDRlHTBFpnBv0w.text: My husband and I went here for dinner and had a great experience!  The food was wonderful, each course was excellent.  We really enjoyed the crab cake appetizer, steaks and the banana's foster bread pudding.  I highly suggest the Knock Out cocktail, it's perfect for this time of year.  Our server Jude was both professional and friendly.  Service was excellent.  What stood out even more about this restaurant though was seeing how everyone else was enjoying their experience!  I was sitting in the corner of the restaurant and had a great view of the dining room.  It was great to see people having fun conversations with the wait staff and enjoying themselves.  I feel like you don't see that too often.  You can tell that the staff at Sullivan's really cares about their patrons and in my book, that makes a restaurant memorable.

SakkTFHC_3h8HyOsQCcgUg.text: Great place to eat the employees are excellent, and great atmosphere Samantha is extremely professional

cBcL-K8xhN7fd5NkzesCvw.text: This is my second review of Sullivan's. Last night we walked over to use a gift card issued us after our last unfortunate visit, Christmas Eve 2011.  We were going to what was to be a 'party' with drink specials and bar bites. Mostly what we found was 1/2 glass or inconsistent wine pours and no bar bites. We ordered a flatbread off the bar menu that came out cold and uncooked. As it turned out, the manager returned our gift card because it took so long for our food to come out.   The people sitting next to us at the bar had a 7:30 reservation for the dining room. When they arrived, they were told to wait in the bar, that it would be 8:00. It had to be closer to 8:30 before they were seated.  We walked to a local favorite and had dinner as we left hungry. Why is this local landmark so disappointing. We meet a friend at Sullivan's every Christmas Eve for dinner, it's a tradition. This year we will meet somewhere else.

sXA7N2x7tQi4WLYw9d64NQ.text: Great experience; 2nd time is always the best. Start with the crab cake, it's fantastic. If you're not feeling a cut of meat, go with the seared scallops and as a side, I highly recommend the Mac and cheese. Very awesome, almost like it is made with cream cheese! Great wine selection, get a bottle for sure. Dessert, cookies and cream pie. I went on a date night and we got out of there for $185. Pretty reasonable considering other similar joints in Charlotte can run you $220 easy. Another bonus is valet is friendly and accommodating. Highly suggested my friends!

Ikdr2KhOYzUmrZW8CnbMXw.text: The food was great. The adult beverage are awesome. The atmosphere was relaxing. The live music was fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great hot tea selection at Sullivans steakhouse...
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheesesteak egg rolls. Yum. Great way to destress after a hectic day. Cool breeze on the patio with flavorful drinks and live music.

USlr620r_dHTsHT-jwWEdg.text: Amazing steak,  best I've ever had!!!!  So much flavor in everything they have!!!!  Service was excellent so personable and very good suggestions!!!!!

E5tFsqZT6-4UHR7PXlB7eA.text: I attended a dinner of 50 guys last week held on the patio. It's a tight fit out there but these folks really did a great job. While the dinner food was prepaid, drinks were on your own. These gals didn't miss a beat. Many of us ate steaks & while the strips needed a steak knife, they were prepared as ordered. That's not an easy task for such a large group.

6OPX59RTJKMFV2-SINJOcQ.text: We have eaten here several times and this is easily one of favorite steakhouses! Top three! I have ordered something different each time and cannot complain about anything. The martinis are great and the wine lost extensive.  If you haven't been, you are missing out! Go ASAP.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Three cheese Mac
Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

Xrx7FOdSNDkIAER-EeGh-g.text: I've frequented Sullivan's many times for lunch but this was my first dinner there.  We took advantage of their 20 year celebration and a special they had.  My husband had the prime rib and it was cooked perfectly rare.  I ordered the salmon rockefeller.  The salmon was on a bed of spinach and topped with Bearnaise sauce, bacon, and crab.  It was very rich and very good.  We both had one side with our entree and couldn't finish it all.  The cocktails were great and the service was awesome.  Jess took great care of us.  We ordered our dessert to go and because we were there celebrating my husband's birthday she brought him out some ice cream on a decorated plate.

fnEs1c7Zs4WXu5lEBSEPfg.text: This was better than I expected- it is New Years Eve and they are offering a fixed menu but none of us know what it's going to cost so we call the waitress over to ask- how much is it? $69 before 6 and 79 after. We get there before 6 but the bill still comes for the higher amount even though the check says we ordered at 5:47. Good was very good for sure and service was ok- she was a little distant as a waitress . The busboy was setting a table near us and knocked into my husbands chair a few times but never apologized . Some tables had New Years Party hats and others didn't- what's that about? Will return for good food just need to iron out a few things.

jQHu4m2Zt9PNeBd3rEessA.text: So I have to say having eaten at every good steak restaurant in Charlotte, this is my least favorite.  Let me start by saying I came during restaurant week, but to me that's the time when a restaurant shines impress me when you are slammed and I will definitely come back.  That said I am not impressed, first of all my ceaser salad had chewy croutons, not exactly sure how you go wrong with a crouton.  Secondly my steak was very mediocre, and honestly I could have had similar at Texas road house etc, honestly if i was paying full price I would probably be a lot more annoyed.   Sorry Sullivans but you could learn a lot from your sister restaurant Del Frisco, which not only remains my favorite but also is one of the best places for restaurant week.

S1t16CtPWhTofqlqoePlpA.text: I also tried Sullivan's during restaurant week. I would not return. The meal began as a disappointment and ended that way.   I began my meal with a Caesar salad. The salad was large but the lettuce was wilted and the croutons were soggy. It was apparent they had prepared the salads much earlier that day, croutons and all, and placed it in the refrigerator. It may have even been prepared the day before. Before our salad plates were removed from the table our steaks were brought out with no where to place them. The four of us literally had to hold up out salad dishes while they placed our steaks on the table.The steak was cooked to order but the potatoes that were served with it had so my much horseradish in them they were inedible. The cheesecake was warm and pretty much tasted like a Sara Lee purchased from the grocery store.   Our service wasn't much better. The waiter whizzed by a couple of times and asked if everything was ok. Each time his hands were full and he never came to a complete stop.   At first I blamed restaurant week, but have been to numerous restaurants over the years and have never experienced such a disappoint. I will never return to Sullivan's and would NOT recommend it to anyone.

9gui5rwSgXtzFCKDcAS_tw.text: Seated on time, no delay with reservation. Food very good food and service. Well worth the money. Parking is tough have to use complimentary valet.

Dyl5R0oUdyzivbjIaUIMqg.text: We visited Sullivan's for dinner Saturday night and decided to start with a drink at the bar.  At 6:30 p.m., we were the only people in there... except for the jazz trio.  Now, I like jazz as much as the next person, but the bar at Sullivan's is fairly small and compact, and the music was pretty loud.  It was good but seemed a little unnecessary.  Our drinks (a dirty martini and a Cosmopolitan) were good, but not great, and were $26 together.  Onto dinner!  Our waiter greeted us and kept mentioning how he'd heard how much we liked Shiraz.  Huh?  He said he'd even send over the sommelier to help us pick a good bottle.  Again, huh?  I finally had to tell him that I thought they'd mixed us up with other people because we had cocktails at the bar.  He showed me his notes from our visit three years ago (tracked through OpenTable?) when we bought a bottle of Shiraz.  Ha!  I appreciate the attention to detail, but it seemed like a little bit of overkill, especially since it'd been three years, and there isn't really an alcohol we don't like.    The fella decided to go with the $39, 3-course menu and got the shrimp cocktail, lettuce wedge and steak.  The shrimp cocktail was fine (it's really hard to mess that up) and there were fewer shrimp than with the full-price appetizer; the lettuce wedge was okay but would've been even better with bacon; and the steak.... well, for Sullivan's being a steakhouse, it was pretty bland.  It almost tasted like bologna to me.  Yikes.  On a better note, I opted for the cheesesteak egg roll appetizer, which was delicious, and the chicken piccata entree, which was tender, moist, and seasoned perfectly.  We each got a glass of wine - not Shiraz! - and our waiter had some good suggestions on those.  I really wanted to have a great experience at Sullivan's, but for the price, there are much better steakhouses in Charlotte.  Bummer.

Y18f_pvwsrVRej78YDI50A.text: My wife and I went it Sullivan's Steakhouse last Thursday it was my first time since being in Charlotte I was pleasantly surprised. The service was great as well as the food. We really enjoyed the experience.

BUrXm_JDVyiLcoT1DLGYPQ.text: Had a limited availability item, a Wagyu cut. Perfection in any sense. Service was excellent. Sides of garlic mashed, garlic Mac and cheese and creamed corn where great. Topped it off with a Jack Daniels Single Barrel.

wdE5EYl0nqNSSvftwYG5CA.text: Excellent food and service. Waitress was very helpful when asked for suggestions. But definitely a once on special occasion place because of pricing. Will definitely be back for next special occasion.

NeiMn44MgVVXy9P3CfTxWA.text: Terrible meal- ordered my steak medium, and it came out like a charcoal pellet. Not only was it well done, it was cooked well beyond well done (inexcusable for a steak restaurant). They had turned a 40+ dollar filet into the texture and toughness of shoe leather. The other guest ordered a ribeye, and her steak quality was subpar. If you are going to spend this much money on a steak dinner, go to Capital Grille. Will never return.

9qLK6TtSEY8WAdS9tYVjhA.text: Another wonderful meal from Sullivan's! The Knockout Martini is a great starter and the Filet is cooked well and with great flavor. Ryan did a great job behind the bar. This remains one of my favorite steakhouses and it does not disappoint.

Ftv2GmxSh4rKbYh_LVedKQ.text: This place is AMAZING! I've been here on several occasions, and the service and food have been top notch. My steak is always cooked just right, and the potatoes and asparagus are great! Go for the dessert, the key lime pie or the cheese cake, you will not be disappointed. The atmosphere is nice and they have valet parking, which I highly recommend.

1j97LO4lUXW5NJcWHUV0Fw.text: Five stars- all the way!!! Excellent wine list, appetizers, sides, desserts, and most importantly- steak! Looking forward to coming back!

LeLTR_kH66BRah5NvG8C8A.text: Service is slow. Food is slow. Everything was served cold and they needed more help. I don't get it. And apparently other people don't either. It's a Friday night at 7:30 and the place is dead.

VbAF_dzrCgWuO4cMOrrSog.text: Came here for restaurant week and it was really nice! We all ordered steak or salmon and it was delicious, wait staff was amazing and thought to our friends parents anniversary. Can't wait to be back.

3nLOjVNqrXFeogoyKbPgWA.text: Best steak and martinis in Charlotte! Our favorite place to eat. Filet trio is my go to. It's not on the menu but it is one of their specials frequently, if it isn't they will make it for you. My husband always gets the bone in filet, and it is phenomenal!

_oy4ILUQs9PiGtVxQyBLuA.text: We took the extended family to Sullivan's (party of 8). I had the salmon which was very good. Daughter had sea bass which she liked and the rest of the crew had steaks and chicken and all were pleased with their food. Appetizers were some type of cheesesteak egg roll or something and everyone loved that. I thought the Calamari was very good as well. Service was good and prompt and they had 2 servers assigned to our table which was great. Our lead server was ok and that's the only knock. He was competent just seemed so scripted and rehearsed it didn't sit well with everyone. So would we return yes. Would we hope to get a different server, yes.

MaEw9_SCTVk_czVJhBOhlQ.text: Excellent experience.  Went for our anniversary.  We were seated promptly to our table with rose petals on it.  We did mention it was our anniversary when making the reservation.  Our waitress, Diana, congratulated us and took our drink order.  Service was prompt and she was quick to answer our questions.  We had the filet and the rib eye.  Both were cooked a nice medium rare as requested.  At the end of the entrees, Diana, came over and let us know dessert was on them, so we're got the cheesecake to share.  It was yummy.  Then, Joe, the manager came over and congratulated us on our anniversary and thanked us for celebrating at Sullivan's.  All in all a great experience.

zoWclgBAHrlZ-9eUHnLwfw.text: Went into the bar and had to wait till a manager came around to get a beer. A beer later I had to ask a busboy for the check. No idea if the food is good, the bartender was terrible and if he doesn't wait on you, you have to go somewhere else! I went across the street to Luciano's and had a great experience!

ldrfS5rduqN9rohUQxJ_jQ.text: With a guest in town, headed to Sullivan's for a great steak in walking distance. Mid-week early dinner, so no concerns with a reservation. The bar looked nice and the decor in the rest of the restaurant is nice too. We both opted for the prix fixe menu, for me it was perfect since the filet is 6oz on that menu. My salad, filet, potatoes were great. My guest had a solid steak and bisque but potatoes were lacking compared to mine. Desserts were okay but nothing special...but neither of us are huge dessert fans. Overall for the price point this met my expectations with a really good steak and evening. Service was also good, wine was good and served properly, too. Will be trying the bar menu the next time I'm here. Probably not the best steakhouse I've been to in my entire life, but a solid option in South End for guests or a nice night out.

wb3ITOJal3g_WEhB03jO4g.text: Dropping Sullivan's down to 4 stars, rather than 5, because one of (if not their best) attribute was their wide selection of drink specials on Thursday and Sunday.  They increased the price of the specials and reduced it to only 1 drink.  Still a good restaurant, but the value is no longer as high.

eIm05AcSTp8g7iZ3CYJh7w.text: BF and I wanted our last dinner in Charlotte to be a nice one so we came to Sullivan's on a coworkers recommendation.  I made reservations via Open Table on Yelp about 2 hours before we went to dinner.  Free valet service upon arrival (with tip, of course) which was kinda weird because some valet cars were parked right in front.   The place was almost full when we walked in.  Seemed like good business on a Thursday night.  The atmosphere and decor made it seem like an up-scale casual restaurant.  Service was on point for the whole night.  When I asked a worker where the restroom was, he actually walked me there across the restaurant instead of pointing or giving directions.  For appetizer, we started with raw oysters which were decently alright.  For entree, one of the specials for the night was a filet mignon trio dish in which the filets are prepared with 3 different toppings/sauces.  My bf ordered the rib-eye, medium rare.  My filets were pretty yummy, but my BF was disappointed with his rib-eye.  It was overcooked and the rib-eye that they serve here is not dry-aged.  He only ate half of his steak unfortunately.  Overall dinner was OK, but nothing too memorable.  We'll likely try another steakhouse in Charlotte next time I'm back in town for business.

photos.caption: Photo of Sullivan's Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet mignon trio

wwJi0CkJvg4JaH4uZc9o_g.text: One of my favorite places to dine in south Charlotte. The ambiance/ lighting is sexy in the bar area which is where I prefer to eat. The wait/ bar staff are positive & knowledgable. They always have my favorite champagne too Great place to go for a date night

xDHhcMtFJIBWpq3urKcqvQ.text: Sullivan's was perfectly decent.  We were there on a Wednesday night, and the place was packed.  It was so loud, my husband and I could barely hear each other.  We both did the Prix Fixe.  I had shrimp cocktail, shrimp & lobster bisque, and the 6 oz filet oscar style.  Hubby had calamari, shrimp & lobster bisque, and an 8 oz filet.  I also ordered a side of macaroni and cheese for us to share.  Both of our apps were good.  The shrimp and lobster bisque had a really nice and complex flavor.  I probably enjoyed it most of all, but it could have used more seafood pieces.  Our steaks were fine, but really nothing to get too excited about.  The oscar topping flavor was too overpowering, in my opinion.  I liked the horseradish mashed potatoes.  The mac and cheese was actually shells and cheese...I don't recommend it.  It wasn't bad, but I've had better for a lot less money.  Dessert was on the house since it was my birthday.  Our server suggested the bread pudding, but I went with the s'mores cake because I wanted chocolate.  I probably should have gone with her suggestion.  The s'mores cake was more of a s'mores pie, and was rather underwhelming.  The service was okay.  There were times when my husband's sweet tea sat empty, which I don't think is okay when you're paying so much for a meal.  All in all, it was fine, but overpriced for the quality of the food and service.  Next time we want to do a high-end steakhouse, we will try a different place.

zCPRtzSQsfcrLQFJ8hFJDQ.text: I have to admit I only like this place on Wed. & Thurs. for their happy hour specials. I can get some great martinis for half price while having a cheap nosh too. The jazz music is always wonderful to relax out to (bit louder inside than out on the patio).  My one small complaint is the uniforms for the women are just awful! Being an upscale steakhouse one should not have women or any shape or size wearing short mini skirts with whatever black hose/fishnets/leggings/etc that they want. It makes this place go a bit down in class for me .  Had din din here one or two times...not bad, but not the best either. Would choose quite a few other steakhouses to have an elegant din.   All in all like I said the happy hour is well worth it!

pt0Q8U20ad9_twk6ir1j6w.text: Dined here with my daughter during a weekend visit to NC.  Loved our experience.  The food was great, absolutely great drinks, with a lovely interior, small but very nice atmosphere.  Service was excellent. Also noticed the nice bar area, with a lounge and live music.  Will definitely return to dine next time in Charlotte.  Definitely worth a visit.

PJx1ycTxZX9AvUNwAAJzHw.text: We came in as a last minute reservation as a party of 17 due to an issue with the steakhouse down the street where our original reservation was. We were treated like valuable guests and were given excellent service and food. Overall the ambiance was great, food was good and service was excellent! Thank you!

Y850uKA1Yf3DDib7J27ZGQ.text: Upscale steakhouse restaurant with great food and ambiance... Try the she crab soul and great lunch specials...One my favorite date night or special occasion place...

_sTgllcdAXDw97FBTsKidg.text: Went here for Valentines dinner, and had a delightful dinner. Both of our steaks were perfection as well as our sides which included mushrooms, mashed potatoes, and a baked potato. The Pineapple Martini was an absolute knockout!!! You must try the bread pudding for dessert!

_0UFEJtE9tDyQy4wA8LKsA.text: My family and I went to Sullivan's on Saturday, July 22nd to celebrate my sisters birthday. As soon as we walked into the establishment I was impressed by how attentive the staff was. Our reservation was on time and we were seated right away. Upon being seated we were greeted by our server, Bradley. Bradley was outstanding. He was attentive without being over the top, and personable. Bradley even went so far as to get me a side of the seasoning that was used on my steak to take home. The entire meal was outstanding. All steaks at our table were cooked perfectly. My mother is a vegetarian who hates fish, she ordered the salmon Rockefeller and was beyond satisfied. The next time I am in Charlotte, I will be going to Sullivan's. Hopefully Bradley is our server again.

tHx0RcUbkzl3q5iZPdJLcQ.text: Nice low-key steakhouse. Easy to drive right past if you're not looking closely for their sign. Offers valet parking. Cheesesteak eggrolls are BOMB! A la carte sides were lacking, we did the season-less broccoli and an gratin potatoes, which more closely resembled a smashed plain baked potato. Salmon Rockefeller was phenomenal and Hubby liked his Oscar style filet, but said there are better available here in Charlotte. Overall, super awesome experience. Love the cozy, intimate seating and friendly staff. Seemed to be very accommodating to the large group that was there during our time too! Give Sullivan's a try!

w62DyiUntYFQ-TW9vuQvFQ.text: The filet mignon steak was cooked perfectly! Crime brulee was delicious. Definitely worth the money

BwblHGFoPsydFSWyuLwD4g.text: First, I'll start with the good.  The three cheese Mac was really tasty.  My Bells Two Hearted ale was awesome.  Okay, I'm done with the good.  The service was some of the worst I've ever had.  I can't blame the waiter 100 percent. He looked like he was working hard,  but when you place a drink or food order, you don't go to other tables and take orders before you put ours in.  We waited long lengths of time for almost everything.  We were a party of 8, so you expect it to take longer with larger parties, but we were there almost 3 hours.  They seemed very under staffed.  Finally got our dinner and two of the orders were wrong.  Everyone was done eating by the time their food finally came. No manager ever came to the table to apologize and nothing was offered for the major inconvenience.  I'm sorry, any reputable establishment would have comp'd the meal, or offered something.  I don't even think I've ever been to a restaurant where a manager doesn't come and and ask how your dining experience was going.  Apparently, that isn't important at Sullivan's.  Never even saw a manager to talk to.  The food overall was only mediocre, so you can't even say it was worth it, because of the cheaper  pricing of restaurant week.  I can tolerate mediocre food but not poor management.  Needless to say, there are so many good places to eat in Charlotte, there is no reason to ever come back here.

wpZjxMGpJxEjaYcxsP8oZg.text: I really want to give Sullivan's 4 stars but in comparing this experience to a recent visit to Longhorn, I just can't bring myself to do it.  Went here with a group from work for an "appreciation dinner"  Normally, Appreciation dinners end up at Chili's or Ruby Tuesday so I was completely shocked we ended up here.  Everything was great service wise.  Foodwise, it was good but I'd expect that from a place like this.  I ordered one of their Mixup lunches which gives you a salad option, a protein and a side.  I ordered the mixed green salad, the porcini mushroom and pepper encrusted strip and an order of carmelized cauliflower as a side.  The strip was amazing.  It came sliced over a layer of steak sauce.  It was cooked perfectly.  The salad was ok....mixed greens with tomatoes, blue cheese and a dressing that I still do not recognize.  The cauliflower came in a mound.  Honestly, this had to be 1/2 to 2/3 of the head of cauliflower.  It was seasoned with capers and other herbs.  While the taste was good, the quantity was entirely too much and I could only eat half.  The decor of the place is as you would expect with a lot of medium to dark wood but it just didn't do anything for me.  Same with the service. While they were all friendly, our water just didn't go beyond what he was expect to do.     Sorry, Sullivans but I can get better service at Longhorn and frankly I think their food is better also.   But still this is a solid or 3 1/2 star review.

WRFw4_TsZk9eWHwsWkDd8A.text: This 4 star rating is based on service. A friend asked me out to dinner here and I already knew I wanted scallops tonight before I looked at the menu. If they had scallops, it was predetermined that's what I would be ordering. So they come out after about 25 minutes. Four bacon wrapped scallops. However, they were covered in a peach BBQ glaze What an awful idea. Scallops are one of those foods that needs a sprinkle of salt and to be served with a half of a lemon. God makes them naturally flavorful. Anything heavy will overwhelm that flavor, which was the case here. So I forced myself to eat these candied scallops. I have no one to blame, but myself, for not reading the menu in detail and ordering seafood at a steakhouse. It simply isn't a smart move. So I'm not going to dock them for having a menu item that seems like a bad idea. The Roasted Corn-Jicama Slaw was unique and tasty. Service was fine. Having been to Sullivan's several times before, I can say there is always great service and a good atmosphere, especially in the bar area where some days there's live music. The dining area is a bit stuffy. Overall recommended.

482n-rztUXyiBg4JKkv7JQ.text: My coworker suggested I check out the happy hour specials here and I was not disappointed. I ordered the cheesesteak eggs rolls, Sriracha shrimp and a blueberry lemon drop martini. Everything was flavorful and felt like a party in my mouth. I loved it!! To top it there was live music on the patio. The energy and vibe here was perfect. I'll will definitely be back for me!
